channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Managing director James heads to Lanzarote to tackle his biggest deal yet - the sale of a £1.5million yellow submarine. A jeweller to the stars wants to pawn her collection to expand her business, while Lawrence appraises a guitar with links to punk band the Sex Pistols owned by a former millionaire who's now living in a bedsit. A doting father-to-be decides to get rid of his pride-and-joy black Ferrari to buy a family home.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Special needs teacher Kerry Smith seeks a holiday home in southern Spain, but her limited budget forces her to consider properties more inland than she would have wished.(n)

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: The property expert discovers a clutter problem in Ben and Kate's Grade II-listed cottage in Shoreham-by-Sea, West Sussex, which is still languishing on the market despite 15 viewings by potential buyers. In nearby Worthing, he presents busy single mother Zoe with a long list of changes required before her home can compete on the housing market.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Amit Kleinberger, the CEO and co-owner of frozen yoghurt chain Menchie's, poses as a participant in a reality TV contest to find out whether consistency is being maintained in his stores. The company has experienced rapid growth and Amit tries to establish what changes must be made to become a billion-dollar business.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Eric Casaburi, a former undercover boss, invites six other employers who also appeared incognito on the show to talk about their experiences of the programme at a restaurant. However, little do they realise that Eric is going to try to fool them by appearing as a waiter. Featuring Kat Cole, Paul Damico, Andy Wiederhorn, Sheldon Yellen, Anthony Wedo and Jane Grote Abell.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glasgow pair Jean and Ron hope their `taste of Scotland' menu will impress their guests. Day two sees Colin and Craig try to claw back the limelight and jolly up the mood.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three East Sussex couples compete for the £1,000 prize, including one pair who divide up the cooking and the hosting, and another duo who cannot seem to stop bickering.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to family-owned Italian restaurant Giuseppi's in Macomb Township, Michigan. Father and son Joe and Sam Borgia's constant fighting is driving customers away, and Gordon discovers one of the restaurateurs is concealing a serious health problem. Nevertheless, he sets about rescuing them from disaster and turning around the failing business.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay comes to the aid of a restaurant in Mount Sinai, New York, which appears to be stuck in the 1980s. The crumbling decor and unenthusiastic head chef at the Handlebar need to be tackled, but owners Bill and Carolyn LeRoy are in denial about the problems they face.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A range of properties in Bournemouth, Dorset, and Sicily provide food for thought for the owners of a B&B in northern France, who are ready for a slower pace of life in a different country.(n)

programme.title: Great British Buildings: Restoration of the Year
programme.desc: The Victorian category comes into focus as Kevin McCloud and Anna Keay present more building restorations in the running for the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors' Restoration of the Year award. Anna explores Mount Stewart, an imposing country house in Northern Ireland, and Wilton's Music Hall in east London. Architectural historian Jonathan Foyle visits the Pump House in Barry, Wales, and historic building surveyor Marianne Suhr looks round a medieval-style castle in Stornoway in the Scottish Highlands. At the end of the programme, it is revealed which buildings have been chosen to make the final shortlist.(n)

programme.title: The Royal House of Windsor
programme.desc: The final episode of the series focuses on the most outspoken heir to the throne, Prince Charles, and the radically different vision of the monarchy he promised for his own reign. From a young age, Charles was determined to do something important with his position in the royal family, doing so as he set up the Prince's Trust charity to help unfashionable causes, and also weighed in on controversial political issues across the years.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Elderly one-eyed South African porcupine Roxy is introduced to a new, younger male called Henning, in the hope that she will find companionship in her old age. Kifaru, the oldest eastern black rhino at Chester Zoo, meets younger female Malindi, with the expectation that they will produce offspring to increase the dwindling population, while the Caribbean flamingos are breeding again.(n)

programme.title: Three Wives, One Husband
programme.desc: Abel Morrison has three wives and 11 children, and his newest wife, Marina, is heavily pregnant, so it's a chaotic time for the family. However, while his first wife Suzie takes the challenges of plural marriage in her stride, his second wife Beth is struggling with Marina's demands on their husband's attention - and things come to a head on the day of the birth.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz with guest captain Claudia Winkleman and Johnny Vegas going up against Jon Richardson and Reginald D Hunter. Sara Pascoe joins resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The popular armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, featuring Line of Duty, University Challenge, Rio Ferdinand: Being Mum and Dad, Comic Relief, Broadchurch, One Night with my Ex, All Round to Mrs Brown's and the News.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The eagle-eyed armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes.(n)

programme.title: Travel Man
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade heads to the Canary Islands for a packed mini-break with actress and writer Lena Dunham, the star and creator of American comedy drama Girls. In the north of the island, Richard and Lena visit a guachinche pop-up restaurant, where they have goat stew before exploring the barren lunar-like landscape around the volcanic Mount Teide and spend the evening stargazing. There is also a sculpture tour, including works by Henry Moore and Joan Miro, as well as layered coffee, a spot of golf and a search for whales.(n)

programme.title: Mutiny
programme.desc: The crew load up their barrels and kit bags for the last time and set off in the blistering heat of northern Australia to make the 1,200-mile voyage to Timor. The final leg of the journey isn't plain sailing and when the winds slow so too does their progress, leaving them facing their most desperate challenge yet - life-threatening dehydration. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bare Knuckle Fight Club
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering the hidden and shocking underground world of bare knuckle fighting, where men from all walks of life compete against each other in bloody battles. The man at the heart of the Fight Club is Shaun Smith, who is being monitored by police as he plans put on the biggest bare knuckle fight ever seen in the UK.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Newly married couple Ed and Clare are planning to start a family soon and will need a larger home. Ed wants to raise his family where he grew up in Lunigiana, Italy, so Jonnie Irwin finds some rural properties within their £250,000 budget. However, Clare wants to remain close to her relatives, so asks Laura Hamilton to find them suitable properties in the Sevenoaks area of Kent.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: The property experts help new grandparents Geoff and Barbara Harrison choose a second home to enjoy with their growing family in Devon or in Languedoc, France.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Kent couple Chris and Sue, who are struggling to decide whether to downsize locally in Royal Tunbridge Wells, or make a completely new start in life by moving to the south of France. With this in mind, she demonstrates what their budget could buy them on the Cote d'Azur.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Debra Mann from Reading, Berkshire, has fallen in love with the Bay of the Somme in the north of France, and has set heart on a holiday getaway where she and her sister can spend time with family and friends. Scarlette Douglas shows them both a selection of properties for a £64,000 budget - with plenty of surprises along the way.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Matt and Vicky Wade ask Casas Manuel to find them a holiday home with plenty of outside space for sunbathing, while Sharon shows her sister's friend three apartments in Almeria.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: A couple who live in Australia are given help looking for a property as they look to spend half of the year in Spain, while a woman is aiming to find a holiday home in Alicante.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: A woman searches for a new home in Alicante, Spain, with a budget of 120,000 euros, while Daniel and Margaret from Glasgow look for a property near to the coast in Almeria.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay continues his travels across America saving failing restaurants from disaster. In the first of two visits to Mill Street Bistro in Norwalk, Ohio, the chef encounters Joe Nagy, who claims he has the best menu from New York to Los Angeles. However, his servers and diners tell a different story, and his resistance to change leads to some explosive confrontations.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Italian family restaurant Sabatiello's in Stamford, Connecticut, where the owner's fiery temper upsets the staff and has left him more than $1million in debt. Gordon's help is urgently needed to get customers back through the door, but the restaurateur does not take kindly to criticism and closes the restaurant down when his employees turn on him.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef comes to the aid of Anthony Trobiano, whose restaurant in Great Neck, New York, is failing even though his partner's parents have given him their life savings and he has taken out half a million dollars in loans. Gordon has some harsh criticism about the unhygienic kitchen and the quality of the food being served, but the owner has trouble accepting his advice.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The owners of Jack's Waterfront at St Clair Shores in Michigan are keen to hear the fiery chef's advice for turning their failing seafood restaurant around. The lakeside location is a popular summer spot with fantastic views, but an uninspiring menu and a manager more skilled at socialising than organising are preventing them from achieving year-round success.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Self-confessed nerd Lachlan strikes gold when he sits down to eat with psychologist Rachel - who turns out to be an avid Star Wars fan. Nanny and part-time weightlifter Lucy hopes to pick up a new partner in the restaurant - and it seems as though charity administrator Caroline may be the one for her - while Alistair, who at 5ft 7 worries about his height, meets magazine editor Emily. Will he be talking tall after their date?.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Paul and Ben face a challenging eviction in London, where a vulnerable tenant in rent arrears has barricaded her front door, and the agents receive a tirade of abuse. Finally, Steve and Ru head to Portsmouth to evict a young family for a landlord who wants her property back.(n)

programme.title: The New Daughter
programme.desc: A writer moves to a rural house with his children, and his daughter becomes fascinated by a nearby burial ground. She begins to behave in a shocking and violent manner, leaving her father convinced she is being taken over by evil spirits. He delves into the history of the house to find the cause of the disturbance and save her from it. Horror, starring Kevin Costner and Ivana Baquero.(n)

programme.title: Jem and the Holograms
programme.desc: A small-town teen's singing video goes viral and catapults her and her sister's band into global super stardom, but their newfound fame threatens to break apart their familial bonds in this spirited adapted musical fantasy(n)

programme.title: Captain Ron
programme.desc: After he inherits a yacht, Chicago businessman Martin totes his family to the Caribbean to claim it. Not having any skill at boating, he hires long-haired, one-eyed low-life Captain Ron, to pilot the heap to Miami. During the journey, the somewhat inept sailor frequently loses his way while becoming a hit with everyone in the family--except Martin(n)

programme.title: Corrina, Corrina
programme.desc: Jessie Nelson's romantic drama, which she also wrote and produced, stars Ray Liotta as Manny Singer, a widower whose young daughter Molly has become almost catatonically withdrawn following her mother's death. Realising he needs help, Manny advertises for a housekeeper and selects Corrina Washington since Molly reacted positively to her. As Corrina draws Molly out of her shell, so Manny falls in love with her, but in 50s America, inter-racial relationships are still frowned on and the pair face prejudice from all sides as their relationship blossoms(n)

programme.title: Sea of Love
programme.desc: A detective looking for a killer meets a seductive woman, who turns out to be a possible suspect in this romantically charged crime drama(n)

programme.title: Ghost World
programme.desc: Two highschool friends,Enid and Rebecca, on the verge of leaving their adolescence behind, try to decide what to do with their lives.Enid discovers a kindred spirit in fellow misfit Seymour, who shares her disgust with the world around them(n)

programme.title: Dark Water
programme.desc: Dahlia and daughter Ceci are happy in their New York apartment until stagnant water begins to seep through the roof. Is someone - or something - living upstairs? Psychological horror from the author of The Ring(n)

programme.title: Hostage
programme.desc: After losing his nerve, LA hostage negotiator Talley retires to a small town. But he must use his old skills when three hoodlums turn a carjacking into an armed stand-off(n)

programme.title: Scent of a Woman
programme.desc: A blind retired military officer spends a fateful weekend in New York in the company of a prep-school student who was hired to take care of him(n)

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Conor O'Neill is usually one step ahead of the loan sharks. But this time, his debts force him to accept a job coaching tough Chicago kids. Conor plans to take the money and run, but when the team starts looking up to him, he realises he'll have to take responsibility for the first time in his life(n)

programme.title: Platoon
programme.desc: This intense drama examines the fight between good and evil among an American infantry platoon in the jungles of Vietnam. Writer/director Stone draws on his own first-hand experiences of combat and takes a close look at the life of foot soldiers, as seen through the eyes of a new recruit(n)

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: The aristocratic daughter of Lord Croft takes on her old man's archaeological mantle, battling the Illuminati, a sinister crew bent on discovering an ancient relic which will enable them to control time. Hi-tech adventure with a leading lady who's at the top of her game(n)

programme.title: The Good Shepherd
programme.desc: A bright student's life is dramatically changed when he is invited to join Skull and Bones, Yale University's powerful secret society. The next 30 years are filled with espionage, secrets and scandal, and the ultimate evolution of the CIA(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Wesley Gibson, un hombre apocado, descubre que su padre, a quien nunca conoció y que fue recientemente asesinado, pertenecía a una sociedad secreta de asesinos. Después de que una atractiva mujer vestida de cuero lo recluta y lo hace miembro de la socieda(n)

programme.title: Enter the Dragon
programme.desc: Bruce Lee uses a martial arts tournament as the pretext to infiltrate the island fortress of a one-armed drug baron. Forget the story, watch the moves(n)

programme.title: Tremors
programme.desc: Tongue-in-cheek horror tale in which a small Nevada desert town is terrorised by giant man-eating worms. Two handymen are forced to postpone their plans to escape their humdrum lives after several mysterious deaths and a series of earthquakes turn out to be the work of predatory subterranean creatures which lay siege to the terrified townsfolk(n)

programme.title: A Beautiful Mind
programme.desc: Russell Crowe stars as maths genius John Nash, who finds that paranoia and schizophrenia are problems he may never solve. Acclaimed drama. Mature themes/flashing images. (2001)(136 mins)(n)

programme.title: Silk
programme.desc: A 19th-century Frenchman's devotion to his wife is tested during his perilous trade missions to Japan in search of rare silkworm eggs. Keira Knightley and Michael Pitt star in this sensual and visually stunning adaptation of Alessandro Baricco's bestseller. Alfred Molina, Koji Yakusho, Mark Rendall. Directed by Francois Girard(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: A man gets a last-chance job coaching a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team and faces the dual challenge of bringing this underdog team to the 1951 state championship and redeeming himself from a mysterious past(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Two aging friends, one a retired composer and the other a filmmaker working on a new project, go on vacation together at a spa resort in the Alps. There, they take stock of their lives and reflect on their artistic accomplishments(n)

programme.title: The Birdcage
programme.desc: Flamboyant Hollywood remake of the 1979 French farce La Cage Aux Folles. When his son's conservative future in-laws come to town, gay club owner Armand and his cross-dressing partner Albert are forced to play husband and wife(n)

programme.title: Sweet November
programme.desc: Touching, tragic romantic drama with Keanu Reeves and Charlize Theron who fall in love with only a short amount of time to spend together(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.desc: A meek young woman emigrates from Ireland to New York City in the 1950s, and finds her heart torn between a magnetic Italian suitor and a charming lad back home(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: A lone astronaut is left behind on the hostile surface of Mars after an exploratory mission goes awry, and must use his ingenuity to create a habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, his crewmates and a team of scientists work to rescue him, in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Wonderland
programme.desc: James Cox directs the sleazy Hollywood murder tale Wonderland, starring Val Kilmer as legendary porn star John Holmes. Using a non-linear plot structure, the film explores different perspectives of the quadruple homicide that occurred on July 1, 1981, in the Hollywood Hills. At the lowest point of his career and the height of his drug addiction, Holmes was implicated in the murders of the Wonderland gang: Ron Launius (Josh Lucas), Billy Deverell (Tim Blake Nelson), Barbara Richardson (Natasha Gregson Wagner), and Joy Miller (Janeane Garofalo). Launius' wife, Susan (Christina Applegate), was the only survivor. Led by Detective Sam Nico (Ted Levine), the police investigation reveals a dark criminal underworld surrounding Holmes, his disapproving wife, Sharon (Lisa Kudrow), and his innocent teenage girlfriend, Dawn Schiller (Kate Bosworth). Eric Bogosian stars as notorious Hollywood nightclub owner Eddie Nash. Wonderland premiered at the 2003 Toronto Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Dead Date.
programme.desc: Billy and Laura are called to a hotel to investigate the murder of a woman who checked in using a pseudonym, and was later found strangled in one of the rooms. Following a chain of evidence, Laura discovers the victim is Crista, a lonely 40-year-old divorcee, had been using an online dating agency, and turns her attention to the woman's past dates as she searches for the culprit. However, the only way to find out whether one of Crista's suitors is a killer is for Laura to sign up to the same service herself, and under Billy's watchful eye, she prepares for what could turn out to be a deadly date. Comedy crime drama, starring Debra Messing.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A jeweller's murder is linked to a prostitution business, and the subsequent trial puts McCoy's job on the line as interested parties try to call in old favours. Award-winning police drama, starring Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate the abduction and murder of a teacher, and later discover it's possible that she knew the culprit. Having arrested one of her students, the courts quickly decide their evidence is inadmissible - but it seems another assailant could be to blame. Benjamin Bratt and Jerry Orbach star.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac, Hawkes and Lindsay investigate the death of a woman found on a subway train and discover that although her hands and face are covered in blood, she has no obvious injuries. Meanwhile, Danny and Stella visit the home of a playboy bachelor who drowned in his indoor pool - and are surprised to learn he has a wedding-cake decoration lodged in his lung. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An explosion at a mausoleum exposes a number of freshly dismembered bodies, prompting the team to launch a multiple murder investigation to identify the victims. Meanwhile, Abby has a personal problem to deal with - and it seems Gibbs is the only person she will confide in. Drama, starring Pauley Perrette and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue
programme.desc: The team searches for a violent escaped convict, while Andy and her training officer track down a missing informant.(n)

programme.title: The Mysteries of Laura
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Dysfunctional Dynasty.
programme.desc: The detective investigates the deaths of an elderly couple who disinherited their gay son after attempts to `cure' his sexuality failed. Meanwhile, Laura leaves this twins in the hands of a strict nanny called Alicia. Comedy drama, starring Debra Messing and Alysia Joy Powell.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An angry woman who blames her former daughter-in-law's new husband for her son's death hires a hitman to exact retribution. Briscoe and Curtis manage to get their hands on the contract killer but fail to understand why his customer has gone to such extreme lengths.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A woman is murdered during an apparent road-rage incident, and the officers unravel a conspiracy involving arson. American crime drama starring Sam Waterston.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Hawkes is accused of killing someone in a bar-room brawl, and seemingly irrefutable evidence is produced against him. Mac and the team are taken off the case, but refuse to accept he is guilty and ponder whether anyone has a motive to frame him. Meanwhile, Stella and Danny answer a call reporting a body found in a peep-show booth. Gary Sinise and Hill Harper star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Lt Col Mann arrives to assist with inquiries into the murder of a marine - a case that becomes personal for Gibbs when he learns one of the witnesses is his ex-wife Stephanie. The team discovers the prime suspect was having an affair with the dead man's spouse, but the case is complicated by the revelation that the victim may have been selling top-secret military information. Starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While performing an autopsy for a class of military students, Ducky discovers the cadaver he is using is the body of a murder victim. In trying to identify the corpse, Gibbs and his team are set on the trail of a career criminal specialising in identity fraud. Meanwhile, Ziva has difficulty separating her personal feelings and professional judgment. Starring David McCallum and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue
programme.desc: During a busy night at the station, the rookies fail to search a prisoner properly and he pulls a gun on Chris. The ensuing investigation by Internal Affairs sees the officers' behaviour scrutinised, and one of their careers could be over. Meanwhile, Andy learns a dark secret about Nick's past. Crime drama, starring Travis Milne.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson, Fin and new detective Nick Amaro delve into the history of a respected basketball player accused of sexual abuse. Starring Dan Lauria and Mehcad Brooks.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and the team try to determine whether a pregnant 13-year-old girl was raped, following a trail of clues that leads to the son of a high-profile political couple. programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: The body of a former CIA director washes up in a swamp, and Langston suspects a revealing book he was working on could hold the key to his death. Meanwhile, a bassist in a country music band is electrocuted mid-song and Stokes and Catherine believe electrical evidence found in his guitar will help them trace the culprit. Crime drama, starring Laurence Fishburne and Jorja Fox.(n)

programme.desc: The unit receives a ransom note demanding the immediate release of imprisoned drugs kingpin Pulpo in exchange for the release of Antonio's son Diego. Crime drama, starring Jason Beghe and Jon Seda.(n)

The second in the series of murder mysteries, starring Dick and Barry Van Dyke alongside Kimberly Quinn and Jonathan Banks.(n)

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

programme.title: Good Burger
programme.desc: Kenan Thompson and Kel Mitchell, stars of the popular Nickelodeon series All That, confront the ogre of faceless corporate tyranny and have fun doing it in this comedy for young people. Ed (Mitchell) is a teenager who lives for his job at Good Burger, a small but friendly neighborhood hamburger stand, while his buddy Dexter (Thompson) also works there, but lack Ed's single-minded devotion to his job -- he's there because he accidentally destroyed the car of his teacher Mr. Wheat (Sinbad) and has to raise money to pay the damages. When Mondo Burger, a mammoth fast-foot chain, opens across the street, it looks like Good Burger is history, until Ed formulates a secret sauce that brings hundreds of new customers to their door. However, the monomaniacal manager of Mondo Burger, Kurt (Jan Schweiterman), is determined to get his hands on the sauce and put Good Burger out of business. Meanwhile, Ed and Dexter must rescue Otis (Abe Vigoda), the world's oldest fast food employee, from the Demented Hills Asylum, and Ed might just find love with Monique (Shar Jackson) if he could take his mind off the burgers long enough to pay attention to her. Good Burger also features basketball star Shaquille O'Neal as himself and George Clinton as one of the Demented Hills inmates(n)

programme.title: Mean Girls
programme.desc: Lindsay Lohan stars as Cady Heron who, having been home-schooled by her parents, is new to high school and totally unversed on how to survive the jungle-like teen society. But, befriended by two other outsiders, goth Janis and gay Damian, she infiltrates queen bee Regina George's hive to bring about her downfall. Mark (Freaky Friday) Waters' teen comedy is a cut above the rest, thanks to a smart screenplay from Saturday Night Live regular Tina Fey (based on Rosalind Wiseman's non-fiction survival guide for young girls, Queen Bees and Wannabees ) and outstanding performances not just from Lohan, but the whole cast (watch out for Tim Meadows as the scene-stealing Principal Duvall)(n)

programme.title: You Again
programme.desc: A high-powered PR professional discovers that her brother is about to marry the woman who made her high school life a living hell in this comedy starring Kristen Bell and Odette Yustman. Back in her teens, Marni (Bell) was a little awkward. These days she's a successful career woman, but the memories of being tormented by popular cheerleader Joanna (Yustman) still make her break into a cold sweat. Flying home for her brother's Will's wedding, Marni realizes to her horror that she will soon be sister-in-law to the pompon-wielding mean girl who once humiliated her in front of the entire student body. And apparently her nemesis learned from the best, because back when Marni's mom (Jamie Lee Curtis) was in high school, Joanna's aunt (Sigourney Weaver) served up the same kind of treatment. Now that they're about to become family, Marni and her mom do their best to let bygones be bygones. But old grudges die hard, and by the time the wedding bells chime, these old foes will already have some saucy stories to share with their grandchildren(n)

Typical episodes demonstrated CPR techniques, the extinguishing of household fires, and the handling of moral dilemmas. programme.title: The Quick and the Dead
programme.desc: This western borrows many conventions from the films of Sergio Leone as it follows the exploits of a female gunslinger involved in a bloody quick-draw contest. Sharon Stone is the female version of "the man with no name." She rides back into her hometown of Redemption looking only for vengeance against Herod (Gene Hackman) the reigning gunslinger. Redemption is under the control of Herod, who uses his strong arm to keep the locals in line and takes 50 cents of every dollar. Every year there is a quick-draw competition in Redemption and while some come to make a name for themselves, or collect the money, Ellen is here to take out Herod. The rest is a series of standoffs, as contenders quickly fall away, revealing who the quickest really is. The colorful cast of characters includes: Kid (Leonardo DiCaprio) who is Herod's son and desperately trying to get out of his shadow, Cort (Russell Crowe), a killer turned preacher who Herod forces into the competition, and many others. Raimi was hand-picked by Stone to direct this spaghetti western and if anything is notable about this film, it's Raimi's contribution. The performances are all well done, despite the fact that Hackman can do this role in his sleep and Stone is trying way too hard to be tough; but this thin plot only carries so far, and it's Raimi's unique visuals that keep things interesting, even when they get ridiculous. More a remake of a Sergio Leone-style western than a darker update of the genre -- what most westerns made in the 90's tried to be -- this western has fun with itself and never really takes itself too seriously(n)

programme.title: Shoot 'Em Up

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: Rusty Griswold, the youngest child from 1983's National Lampoon's Vacation is all grown up with a family of his own and fond childhood memories of a certain family road trip to Walley World, "America's Favorite Family Fun Park." Like his father, Clark (Chevy Chase), Rusty wants to forge closer bonds with his own family - wife Debbie (Christina Applegate) and boys James and Kevin (Skyler Gisondo and Steele Stebbins) - so he buys a souped-up Albanian van and convinces them to set off on their own crazy cross-country jaunt to Walley World. Directed by John Francis Daley and Jonathan M. Goldstein(n)

Director: Steven Soderbergh (Conclusion of tonight's film)(n)

Under pressure to appease the firm's clients, but having discovered the seriousness of the corporation's iniquities, Clayton finds himself torn between his desire to do the right thing and a pressing need to pay off spiralling personal debts(n)

programme.title: Pitch Black
programme.desc: A spaceship crashes on a remote planet and the survival of the stranded passengers may depend on a convict, whose special gift comes in handy when night falls(n)

programme.title: Halloween: Resurrection

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: One of the most celebrated horror films of the late '70s is given a new look in this remake, produced by blockbuster filmmaker Michael Bay. George and Kathy Lutz (Ryan Reynolds and Melissa George) are a young couple who are looking for a new home, and think they've found a dream house in Amityville, Long Island -- a large and beautiful home available at a bargain price. George thinks that there must be a catch, and learns that the house has a dark history -- a year before, a man living in the house murdered his family in their sleep, claiming he was commanded to commit the crime by demons. Shrugging off stories that the house is haunted, George and Kathy move in with their three kids, only to discover that something evil lurks within the house, and even Father McNamara (Philip Baker Hall), an expert on possession, is powerless to clear the dark spirits from the home. The Amityville Horror was based on the same book by Jay Anson that provided the basis for the 1979 film, which in turn documented an actual incident(n)

programme.title: Constantine
programme.desc: A cop tangles with demons and angels when she probes her twin's death with a man who has literally been to hell and back. Supernatural thriller based on the "Hellblazer" graphic novels(n)

programme.title: Hellboy II: The Golden Army
programme.desc: Cigar-chomping demon Hellboy (Ron Perlman), the Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense's secret weapon against things that go bump in the night, returns to battle a supernatural prince with an ancient grudge against puny humans. Writer-director Guillermo del Toro's sequel improves on his original, showcasing wickedly elegant monsters and spectacular action sequences(n)

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: This utterly chilling horror film centers on a young woman who must protect her brother from a terrifying apparition that only manifests in total darkness. Later, she realizes that this fearsome entity is connected to her mentally ill mother, who has started hallucinating conversations with a mysterious figure named Diana(n)

programme.title: The Cotton Club

programme.title: Bird on a Wire

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Seafaring adventure as, during the Napoleonic wars, a British frigate is sent to track and engage a larger French warship, the Acheron, off the coast of South America. The intense and duty-driven captain of the British vessel must try to coax his war-weary crew to victory, amid a series of explosive naval battle scenes. Based on the novels by Patrick O'Brian(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Grand Visions is a short season of films driven by the vision and boldness of strong directors; passion projects made on a grand and uncompromising scale. The season kicks off with director Baz Luhrmann's western/ war adventure/ romance hybrid that's set in the Australian outback and stars Nicole Kidman and Hugh Jackman. It is 1939 and Lady Sarah Ashley has travelled halfway round the world to persuade her husband to sell his cattle station and return back home to Blighty. It's soon obvious that she hasn't anticipated the primitive realities of life in northern Australia, nor has her upbringing prepared her for an encounter with the likes of the rough and ready drover who is instructed to chaperone her from Darwin to the ranch. But the pair are fated to become much more closely acquainted than either could have imagined. The plot also encompasses the lot of the region's Aboriginal people, via the plight of local lad Nullah, and the first Japanese attacks on the northern territories. Edited for language(n)

programme.title: Animals in Love
programme.desc: Mating for Life. Liz Bonnin explores the complex and diverse relationships that animals have and asks whether animals love. For centuries it was thought that animals did not share the same emotions as us but new science is starting to change that view. She starts by travelling to the Democratic Republic of the Congo to meet some bonobos who seem to have found the secret of long-lasting successful relationships. From wild dogs in Africa to tamarins in the UK, Liz continues her journey to find out what it takes to have a successful relationship in the animal kingdom. In Switzerland Liz learns about Tariq, a goose who, when faced with a choice, stuck firmly to his mate. She also meets Dotty and Zee, a pair of penguins who defied expectation when after ten years together as a devoted couple, it was discovered that things were not quite as they seemed. Finally, in search of an answer to her question, Liz meets a Siamang gibbon called Sam and hears how he dealt with the death of his life partner(n)

programme.desc: Birds and the Bees. A snow leopard named Leo that was rescued from Pakistan has trouble eating because of a broken tooth; the bird department works fast to restore a beehive; a fennec fox gets extra attention from the Ambassador Center staff(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Holding Back the Years
programme.desc: Bill Turnbull visits Edinburgh to expose some of the fake news concerning health in old age, touching on themes such as pioneering experiments and new NHS treatment options. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts explore a flat conversion in Glasgow, a purpose-built flat in Stoke-on-Trent and a large pub in Hastings, East Sussex.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Metropolitan Police officers try to identify a suspect accused of killing a man and shooting a policeman in Brazil, back in November 1994. A Welshman who became a multi-million pound drug smuggler is arrested in South Africa. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright meets a man who almost lost everything when his dream job turned out to be part of a complex fraud. Plus, a look at the counterfeit computer hard drives that can cost consumers data as well as money, and the truth about fake hairdryers.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin presents from the Quayside Antiques centre in Topsham, near Exeter, as Danny Sebastian and Gary Pe assist two teams picking up items to sell at auction.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Ayesha tries to get to the bottom of her visitor's troubles, while Mrs Tembe finds it hard to confide in Ruhma about her new relationship. Elsewhere, a restaurant is petrol bombed.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Matt Allwright hosts the quiz, inviting three close friends from Stratford-upon-Avon to answer questions in order to crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple of retirees with £700,000 to spend on their dream home. She also tries her hand at the country art of thatching.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore enlists the help of Mark Haig to turn a Second World War field telephone into something functional again. She also brings an Edwardian single bed into the 21st century.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: The programme revisits some of the locations from the series, including Greenwich Royal Naval College, Althorp House in Northamptonshire, and Herstmonceux Castle, East Sussex.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon hosts the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: Inside Out London
programme.desc: Gareth Furby meets activists protesting against Heathrow's third runway and Mark Jordan finds out how virtual reality is helping hospice patients. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As the Albert Square residents continue to reel from recent events, family and friends try to pull together. But it remains to be seen who will stand by their loved ones, and whether the past can be forgotten quite so easily.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Journalist and broadcaster Amol Rajan sets the brief as John Torode and Gregg Wallace introduce the first quarter-final, from which the best contestants go through to Knockout Week. His challenge for the amateur cooks is to make an exceptional dish, choosing from one of two briefs he has given them. The contestants must either cook a savoury dish using Indian spices or a chocolate dessert with a playful twist. After cooking their dish, the candidates must stand before Amol, John and Gregg and hear what they think of their dish and how well they have adhered to the brief.(n)

programme.title: Decline and Fall
programme.desc: New series. Jack Whitehall, David Suchet, Eva Longoria, Tim Pigott-Smith and Douglas Hodge lead an all-star cast in James Wood's adaptation of Evelyn Waugh's comic novel. Oxford University divinity student Paul Pennyfeather is wrongly dismissed for indecent exposure, having been made the victim of a prank. He seeks employment at an obscure public school in Wales, where he encounters the glamorous mother of one of the pupils. For Paul it is love at first sight, but little does he know the surprises that lie ahead of him when he agrees to tutor her son over the summer holidays.(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: On Stranger Tides
programme.desc: Captain Jack Sparrow sets sail in search of the legendary fountain of youth. His mission puts him up against a mysterious woman from his past, old enemy Barbossa, now in the employ of the British Navy, and the most feared pirate of them all, the dreaded Blackbeard. Fantasy adventure sequel, with Johnny Depp, Penelope Cruz, Geoffrey Rush and Ian McShane.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: John Torode is joined by chefs Ben Tish and Tommy Banks and wine expert Peter Richards. Featuring classic clips from Rick Stein, Nigella Lawson, the Hairy Bikers and the Spice Men.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.desc: The food writer shares ideas to make everyday family meals special with no-fuss dishes and also tries her hand at milking a goat before showing her granddaughter how to make her own goat's cheese for a family picnic.(n)

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests look forward to the weekend's fixtures, which include Liverpool v Everton and Arsenal v Manchester City in the Premier League.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott heads to Ardingly in Sussex where two sets of Bargain Hunt teams go head-to-head to grab the best finds. Expert Anita Manning leads a team of brothers and a pair of musicians for the reds, and Mark Stacey's blues are a married couple celebrating their wedding anniversary and a couple of animal lovers.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a buyer find a home in Snowdonia close to her family and able to accommodate a business, as well as learning about shepherding in the protected landscape.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a Walsall tip, including an art deco train set and a broken sofa, with help from designer Jay Blades. Arthur Smith narrates.(n)

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland.(n)

programme.title: Madagascar
programme.desc: A gang of streetwise penguins decides to escape from New York's Central Park Zoo and return to a life in the wild, but when Marty the zebra and his friends follow suit, they end up stranded in Africa on a jungle island without a clue about how to fend for themselves. Animated comedy, with the voices of Ben Stiller, David Schwimmer, Chris Rock, Jada Pinkett Smith and Sacha Baron Cohen.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a medical version of the celebrity quiz, with contestants Guy Henry, Rosie Marcel, Vicki Pepperdine, Ricky Grover, Raji Singh, Hilary Jones, Charles Dale and Amanda Henderson trying to come up with the least likely correct answers to a series of questions posed to members of the public.(n)

programme.title: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: Game show in which Nick Knowles challenges two pairs of complete strangers to team up, with each pair battling to outdo the other by listing as much as they know about a given subject. The first couple to win two rounds get to play for £50,000 and each time the champions defeat a new set of opponents their winnings mount up.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Alicia wakes up in Sam's bed, while Iain and Gem's relationship is tested when they spend the day together on the rig and Iain is confronted with his biggest fear. Evie is confronted at home by a masked intruder who attacks her and ransacks the property, and when Evie manages to escape, she is hit outside by Susie's car.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Agnes and the family are joined by Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield, who are put through their paces in the Brown family version of The Cube, while Lulu pops in for a chat. Dermot and Buster recruit EastEnders' icon Adam Woodyatt and get him to spout wildly inaccurate facts to the tour group along the way to help with their new business venture, and Ricky Wilson gets intimate with Agnes in Foley's pub before the Kaiser Chiefs play out with their latest hit Hole in My Soul.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Liverpool v Everton at Anfield and Burnley v Tottenham Hotspur at Turf Moor. The Reds were looking to continue their outstanding recent record against their local rivals, while Spurs were the latest club to try to put a blemish on Burnley's superb home record this season.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: A dawn raid in London leads to the arrest of an elusive Portuguese woman wanted for embezzlement. West Yorkshire police track a teenager's attacker all the way to Slovakia.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: A team at the Bristol Upholstery Collective get to work on an old three-piece suite, while woodworking duo Josh and Oli try to make something of an old oak beam.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Land with Kate Humble
programme.desc: The presenter is in South Devon to meet cider-makers who are trying to reverse the trend of apple orchard decline as they plough a six figure sum into a new orchard on their land. She also follows a farming family who have tapped into the trend for the UK's answer to olive oil, and discovers a young lad with no farming background who is running a modern business with traditional Devon sheep breeds. Plus, entrepreneur Geetie Singh-Watson finds how online shopping is bringing our markets closer together and enabling an edible flower grower to thrive.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country, presented by Andrew Neil.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Holiday of My Lifetime with Len Goodman
programme.desc: Former Strictly Come Dancing judge Len Goodman takes ex-footballer and TV presenter Dion Dublin on a journey to Great Yarmouth to recreate a seaside holiday from 1979. The pair travel in a 1970s Morris Marina Coupe, get competitive in a football match, play a game of air hockey in the arcade, and compete in Segway racing.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Swimmer Rebecca Adlington joins comedy entertainer Brian Conley for a nostalgic look at the archive television programmes that helped set her on the path to Olympic success. Her selections include Fawlty Towers, Blind Date and Art Attack.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Bafta-winning actress Julie Walters, of Educating Rita, Mamma Mia! and Harry Potter fame, traces her roots back to Co Mayo in western Ireland, where her great-grandfather Anthony Clark was one of the first members of the Land League. The organisation was formed in 1879 and campaigned for more than 40 years for the rights of tenant farmers to own their own land.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Vet Steve helps a kestrel with a damaged wing get back into the wild, while equine specialist Sybil treats a pony with a locked leg - and a reputation for misbehaviour. At the Small Animal Hospital in Fife, heart and lung expert Craig is under pressure as he attempts to save a Yorkshire terrier's life. Narrated by Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals how the competition to breed creates scenes of the most extraordinary beauty, as well as some of the most violent battles seen in nature. A male flame bowerbird shows off its artistic prowess to impress a potential mate - but if that does not prove enough, it will demonstrate its dancing skills instead. Waved albatrosses pair up for life and spend hours in each other's company, although things are not so simple for a male peacock jumping spider - one wrong move in its dazzling courtship routine could prove fatal. However, one of the most magnificent displays of all is created by a tiny male pufferfish, which impresses the ladies by building a spectacular underwater `crop circle' in the sand - arguably the most perfect and complex structure created by any animal.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Anita Manning and Philip Serrell kick off their final leg in Castle Douglas, Kirkcudbrightshire, and finish at a nail-biting final auction in Crooklands in the Lake District.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Ceramicist Kirsten Ramsey works on putting a shattered vase by Jean Lurcat, a contemporary of Picasso's, back together again. An Italian chair and a jewellery box are also restored.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo concludes his journey in the Netherlands, where he travels from Rotterdam to Utrecht, including a visit to the world's largest flower auction in Haarlem, a trip to Delft to learn how the city came to specialise in pottery and an exploration of the government buildings in The Hague.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don begins a brand new project when he starts a new soft fruit garden, and also plants new potatoes and divides herbaceous plants in the jewel garden. Frances Tophill visits an extraordinary tropical garden in Barbados developed from a collapsed cave, while the programme also catches up with exponent of gardening for wildlife Chris Baines, in his own small town garden. Plus, as part of the series' 50th anniversary, Mark Lane nominates the plant he thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half century. Including weather.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the second semi-final, in which two teams of contenders use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between groups of four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of Pudding and Cheese, Maria and Peter, Widow and Murder, and Ops and Funk.(n)

programme.title: The House That £100K Built
programme.desc: Kieran Long and Piers Taylor follow the fortunes of Jody and Lori, who are desperate for a modern family home and have decided to gamble everything they have on building a new one from scratch. Kieran takes the couple to see a series of homes tailor-made for the people that live in them. Each is packed with ideas they could try. As the build gathers pace, Lori struggles to make colour choices, so Piers explains the basics of colour theory, but will they really move from safe whites and greys to bold oranges and blues? Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists Phill Jupitus, Josh Widdicombe, Sara Pascoe and Alan Davies compete, as Stephen Fry goes looking for monsters. As usual, the host poses questions that are so difficult, points are awarded for the answers he finds most interesting.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Angela Scanlon present the next stage of the contest, with robots Supernova, Frostbite, Wyrm, High 5, Crushtacean, Ironside 3, Pulsar and Apex battling it out through a series of nine face-offs. Professor Noel Sharkey, Dr Lucy Rogers and Professor Sethu Vijayakumar judge the outcomes, while Jonathan Pearce provides running commentary on the action.(n)

programme.title: Shadow Dancer
programme.desc: An IRA member is arrested while attempting to plant a bomb on the London Underground in 1993. A British intelligence operative offers her the chance to avoid a lengthy prison sentence and separation from her son by sending her back to Belfast to spy on her fellow militants - including her own family. Thriller, starring Andrea Riseborough, Clive Owen and Gillian Anderson.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Last week, the Parliament came under attack in the most serious terror incident in the country for more than a decade. Speaking to witnesses and the injured, this programme pieces together what happened during an assault that left five people including the attacker dead and many more injured, and also looks into the life of Khalid Masood to ask what motivated him to carry it out.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: An audience in Birmingham is given a chance to have a say at a hugely significant moment in British history, with the Government about to trigger Article 50 and start the process of leaving the European Union after the win for the Leave campaign in the vote held on June 23 last year. David Dimbleby hosts this special edition of the programme, which gives members of the public the chance to put questions about the implications of Brexit to a panel of senior politicians from both of the EU referendum campaigns. Includes contributions by panellists including Brexit Secretary David Davis and his Shadow Cabinet counterpart Keir Starmer, former Deputy Prime Minister Nick Clegg, former First Minister of Scotland Alex Salmond, Deputy Chair of UKIP Suzanne Evans and the Times columnist Melanie Phillips.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter J, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: Beautiful But Dangerous
programme.desc: An heiress returns to her home town to shower gifts on the people who donated money in order for her to undergo a life-saving operation when she was a child. However, the woman is not prepared for the consequences of her good deed. Comedy drama, starring Jean Simmons, Robert Mitchum, Arthur Hunnicutt and Edgar Buchanan.(n)

programme.title: We Dive at Dawn
programme.desc: A British submarine crew is unexpectedly ordered to carry out a top-secret mission to sink the German fleet's latest battleship in the Baltic Sea. But it is not long before disaster strikes and the vessel becomes stranded in the middle of the ocean with no fuel or food. Second World War adventure, starring John Mills, Eric Portman, Reginald Purdell and Niall MacGinnis.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates Brad Bestelink's documentary, which was filmed over the course of 18 months and follows a female leopard and its two cubs living in the wilds of Botswana alongside less-than-friendly lions, wild dogs and hyenas. The competition for food is tough, and the cats have to learn the new skill of fishing if they are to have any chance of survival.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Dion Dublin and Martin Roberts explore an end-of-terrace house in south Wales, a semi-detached three-bedroomed property in Southampton, and an ex-council flat in east London.(n)

programme.title: Raymond Blanc: How to Cook Well
programme.desc: The chef gives six masterclasses in basic cooking techniques, using each one to demonstrate five dishes, with recipes ranging from simple to ambitious. He begins with the slow-cooking method, preparing an Asian-flavoured beef shin with papaya salad, a squid and chorizo stew, and a compressed apple terrine.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the food provided by British waterways as they fly-fish for trout, prepare a meal of stuffed wild duck and discover how the Gloucestershire tradition of eating baby eels has virtually disappeared.(n)

programme.title: Gypsy
programme.desc: Musical about striptease artist Gypsy Rose Lee and her relationship with her ambitious mother, who was determined to make stars of both her daughters. The only place Rose can find work is in a burlesque house, where the established strippers help her make it to the top. Starring Rosalind Russell and Natalie Wood. Stephen Sondheim's songs include Everything's Coming Up Roses, Let Me Entertain You and Small World.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Bill Bailey narrates this natural history documentary telling the story of some of nature's most extraordinary partnerships, revealing what sometimes happens when animals need an itch scratching, help getting into food or home security assistance. The answer is, to find a partner - and not necessarily one of the same species. Highlights include hippos joining forces with fish for a full-body exfoliation and ravens inviting wolverines over for some bone-crunching assistance with their dinner.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The first semi-final takes place as two teams of four students compete to make it to the final of the competition, which was won last year by Peterhouse, Cambridge. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts the second semi-final, in which two teams of contenders use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between groups of four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of Pudding and Cheese, Maria and Peter, Widow and Murder, and Ops and Funk.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Experts Kate Bateman and David Barby search for antiques that can be sold for a profit in Colchester, Essex, where finds include boxes of old toy cars and an art deco item. Presenter Paul Martin tracks down the last remaining practitioner of an ancient craft that once lifted people out of poverty.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don begins a brand new project when he starts a new soft fruit garden, and also plants new potatoes and divides herbaceous plants in the jewel garden. Frances Tophill visits an extraordinary tropical garden in Barbados developed from a collapsed cave, while the programme also catches up with exponent of gardening for wildlife Chris Baines, in his own small town garden. Plus, as part of the series' 50th anniversary, Mark Lane nominates the plant he thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half century. Including weather.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti join the staff working in some of the most extraordinary hotels around the world, beginning with Marina Bay Sands in Singapore, which employs 9,500 people and caters for a million guests a year. Their duties include acting as attendants at the world's largest infinity pool, working as a butler under a former special forces officer, and joining a catering team that provides Brazilian, Chinese, French and Japanese cuisine for 60 restaurants.(n)

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton embarks on his most difficult journey to date as every destination has been long abandoned by people, meaning there are no ferries, piers or proper landing stages. He visits the once-inhabited island of Heisgeir, sails around the gannet haven of Sula Sgeir and endures rough seas to make landfall on the extraordinarily remote island of North Rona. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.sub-title: The Bullet Is Not for Firing.
programme.desc: The men of Walmington-on-Sea's Home Guard use up all their ammunition shooting at a passing aircraft, leaving Captain Mainwaring no alternative but to hold a court of inquiry to find out what really happened. Comedy first aired in 1969, starring John Le Mesurier, Arthur Lowe and Clive Dunn.(n)

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: An extended edition of the comedy quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers host Stephen Fry finds most interesting. In this edition, he invites David Mitchell, Sue Perkins and Sami Shah to join regular panellist Alan Davies as he meanders about some places that start with the letter M.(n)

programme.title: Jimi: All Is By My Side
programme.desc: Premiere. Biopic of Jimi Hendrix following the events of 1966, when he left New York to spend a year living in London. The relationships he developed over that time would shape his career as a musician, culminating in his famous appearance at the Monterey Pop Festival. Starring Andre Benjamin, Hayley Atwell and Imogen Poots.(n)

programme.title: Populaire
programme.desc: A woman desperate to escape her small-town roots applies for a job as a secretary at an advertising agency. Her ability to type quickly catches the eye of an executive, who trains her to take part in a speed-typing contest. Comedy set in the 1950s, starring Deborah Francois, Romain Duris and Berenice Bejo. In French, English and German.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jensen introduce performances from 7 July by Roman Holliday, Mary Jane Girls, Freeez, the Cure, Funk Masters, and Jimmy the Hoover.(n)

programme.title: BBC Young Dancer 2017
programme.desc: Anita Rani hosts this contest showcasing the very best British dance talent aged between 16 and 21. This edition focuses on the ballet category, featuring contenders Ryan Felix, Jade Wallace, Rhys Antoni Yeomans, Uyu Hiromoto and Oscar Ward. Judging them are former principal dancer with the Royal Ballet Deborah Bull, former artistic director of English National Ballet Matz Skoog and choreographer and founder of the dance company that bears her name Shobana Jeyasingh. The other categories are dance music, contemporary and South Asian, and the contest culminates in a grand final to be staged at Sadler's Wells.(n)

programme.title: Big Hits: TOTP 1964 to 1975
programme.desc: A selection of performances from the first years of Top of the Pops, featuring the Rolling Stones, Peter Sarstedt, Tom Jones, Stevie Wonder, Julie Driscoll, Queen, the Kinks, Procol Harum, Stealers Wheel, the Seekers and Status Quo.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1977
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops 1977: Big Hits.
programme.desc: A selection of highlights from the pop show's 1977 editions, including performances by Rod Stewart, the Jacksons, Queen, the Stranglers, Brotherhood of Man, David Bowie, Bob Marley, Baccara, Heatwave and Elvis Costello.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1978
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops: The Story of 1978.
programme.desc: Documentary about the change of musical direction in 1978, when pop singles were slowly ousted by disco, punk and new wave artists. The programme features contributions by members of the Boomtown Rats, Squeeze, Boney M and Sham 69 - among others - and archive performances by the likes of Elvis Costello, the Undertones, Ian Dury and the Blockheads and the Jam.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1978
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops 1978: Big Hits.
programme.desc: A selection of classic songs from 1978, a year in which punk music and new wave rebellion co-existed with pop, disco, soul, reggae and prog rock. Featuring appearances on the show by Ian Dury, Elvis Costello, Blondie, Bob Marley, Boomtown Rats, Kate Bush, Sham 69, Brotherhood of Man, Dan Hill, Boney M, 10cc and Manfred Mann's Earth Band.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1983
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jensen introduce performances from 7 July by Roman Holliday, Mary Jane Girls, Freeez, the Cure, Funk Masters, and Jimmy the Hoover.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: The Story of 1979
programme.desc: A look back at a heady year for the chart show, which recorded its highest audience of 19 million viewers, as physical format singles peaked at four times that number. Social problems in Britain during the Winter of Discontent did not stop inventive musicians from making hay as eager fans queued up to embrace their output, and new wave, ska, reggae, rock, folk and electro hits competed for the top slots. Among the featured artists are Gary Numan, Nile Rodgers, Jah Wobble and Woody from Madness.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1977
programme.sub-title: Top of the Pops 1977: Big Hits.
programme.desc: A selection of highlights from the pop show's 1977 editions, including performances by Rod Stewart, the Jacksons, Queen, the Stranglers, Brotherhood of Man, David Bowie, Bob Marley, Baccara, Heatwave and Elvis Costello.(n)

programme.title: The Silk Road
programme.desc: Sam Willis traces the history of one of the world's most famous trade routes, which ran from China's ancient capital Xian through the cities of central Asia and Persia. He begins his travels in Venice, examining how the architecture was shaped by Eastern influences, before arriving in China's ancient capital Xian where he discovers how a single deal to trade silk for war horses created a global network.(n)

programme.title: Woolly Mammoth: Secrets from the Ice
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores the natural history of the Ice Age mammals that once roamed across what is now Europe and Asia. Detailed information about their lives has been gleaned from carcasses preserved in the Siberian permafrost, and the anatomist meets scientists using genetic, chemical and molecular tests to reveal the adaptations that allowed mammoths to evolve from tropical animals to creatures capable of surviving extreme cold.(n)

programme.title: Follow the Money

programme.title: Follow the Money

programme.title: Mean Girls
programme.desc: Lindsay Lohan stars as Cady Heron who, having been home-schooled by her parents, is new to high school and totally unversed on how to survive the jungle-like teen society. But, befriended by two other outsiders, goth Janis and gay Damian, she infiltrates queen bee Regina George's hive to bring about her downfall. Mark (Freaky Friday) Waters' teen comedy is a cut above the rest, thanks to a smart screenplay from Saturday Night Live regular Tina Fey (based on Rosalind Wiseman's non-fiction survival guide for young girls, Queen Bees and Wannabees ) and outstanding performances not just from Lohan, but the whole cast (watch out for Tim Meadows as the scene-stealing Principal Duvall)(n)

programme.desc: The unit is tipped off about terrorist activity, and two agents are murdered during the ensuing investigation. programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A jet-skier crashes on to the shore and is discovered to be dead, having been shot through the chest. Sam and Callen visit the victim's apartment, where they find the body of a woman on the floor.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible

programme.desc: Scott Miller treats a dog that has developed a painful limp, while a Labrador with three legs is developing another worrying mass and a pet hedgehog needs to be put on a diet.(n)

programme.desc: The United States is in the grip of an illiteracy crisis, with nearly one in five adults now unable to read. Reporter Kiki King visits Detroit, a city where two thirds of high school students struggle with basic reading and where things have deteriorated so much that a group of high school students is suing the state of Michigan for failing to teach them adequately.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect looks back at some amazing spaces, from a double decker bus with a retractable roof to a futuristic house with a living room hidden under the bed. George also recalls a trip to Germany featuring a space where an entire room mechanically opened like a drawer.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Hosts Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by three stars of new West End play The Philanthropist, as Lily Cole, Simon Bird and Tom Rosenthal help the trio dissect the week's events. The hosts make use of the £isitok twitter handle, where viewers tweet in edgy current affairs questions that more fearful shows might duck.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Self-confessed nerd Lachlan strikes gold when he sits down to eat with psychologist Rachel - who turns out to be an avid Star Wars fan. Nanny and part-time weightlifter Lucy hopes to pick up a new partner in the restaurant - and it seems as though charity administrator Caroline may be the one for her - while Alistair, who at 5ft 7 worries about his height, meets magazine editor Emily. Will he be talking tall after their date?.(n)

programme.title: How'd You Get So Rich
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan continues to hang out with a selection of the richest people in the world, including two men who made their millions from selling sex toys, a woman who creates luxury creams from bee venom and a man who designs the most exclusive cars on the planet.(n)

programme.title: Battle: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The Earth is bombarded by what appear to be meteors, but turn out to be the vanguard of an alien invasion force. As America's west coast comes under heavy attack, a platoon of soldiers is sent in to fight off the aliens and rescue civilians - but the troops have only a few hours to complete their mission before the area is bombed. Sci-fi thriller, with Aaron Eckhart and Ramon Rodriguez.(n)

programme.title: Time Crashers
programme.desc: The celebrities find themselves working in a Victorian fishery in 1885, where they have one day to fulfil a huge order destined for London's Billingsgate Market. The harsh conditions and backbreaking work prove to be a real shock to the system for Kirstie, Fern and Louise, who have to gut 100 fish by hand, while Meg and Zoe attempt to navigate the mudflats wearing strange footwear. The men rake mussels and collect oysters from the shoreline but it is slow going, so Greg and Jermaine head off on a boat to dredge for oysters.(n)

programme.title: Catastrophe
programme.desc: Rob returns to his job at Braeband stating he is just back from holiday in Canada, while bad news pulls Sharon back to Ireland. With Sharon away, and left home alone to look after the children, Rob's life continues to spiral out of control. Unhappy with the situation at his family home Chris decides, in typical style, to confront his nemesis. Comedy about an Irish woman and an American man's relationship, written by and starring Sharon Horgan and Rob Delaney.(n)

programme.desc: Debra realises Ray is planning something for her birthday and suggests having a Chinese banquet, but her mother has already started organising an old-fashioned English tea party. Katherine Helmond guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Having advised a caller to break up with his girlfriend, Frasier ends up dating her himself - and bends the rules of professional ethics to continue the relationship. Comedy, guest starring Amanda Donohoe.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin is reunited with an old friend - and Niles and Frasier begin to suspect the pair may once have had an affair. However, the truth proves even more shocking. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Extreme Food
programme.desc: Kenyan chef Kiran Jethwa travels to the Nepalese Himalayas, where he joins local honey hunters as they trek into the surrounding valleys in search of a hive.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Carpenter Neil hosts the second dinner party in and around Belfast in a bid to win the £1000 prize, presenting good old fashioned, country style cuisine to his guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Keen golfer and window cleaning business owner Paul hosts the third dinner party in Belfast, hoping to impress his guests with take on fine dining.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Livewire DJ and events organiser Ryan is the next to host in and around Belfast - and having arranged parties for thousands, he will confident he can satisfy four fellow diners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cailin is pinning her hopes of winning on a Eurovision extravaganza on the final night of competition in Belfast, creating a series of tried and tested dishes from across Europe.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Wiltshire couple Martin and Michelle MacClay want a holiday home in France's Loire Valley, so Scarlette Douglas helps find them the perfect property on a budget of £73,000.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is in the countryside surrounding Edinburgh helping Ian find a new home - but it soon becomes clear that he is more interested in finding the right shed for his collection of cars and tools than somewhere to lay his head. Phil Spencer is with Rogan and Jane, who suffer from chronic indecision when it comes to house hunting - and that's the least thing they need as they have to find a home fast before their first baby arrives in three months' time.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Clinton Dall from West Sussex, a self-made businessman and father of four aiming to build one of the largest homes ever featured on the show. Dall wants the end project to be perfect - from the finish of his mirrored cruciform steel columns, to how the floor tiles line up with the dining room table, and is willing to spend whatever it takes to achieve his vision. However, the construction represents a huge risk, as down one road lies abject failure and financial ruin, while down the other, is the creation of something sublime and almost heroic.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Titanic
programme.desc: A party of explorers studying the sunken remains of the famous liner meets an elderly woman who was a passenger on the ill-fated maiden voyage. She recounts how she boarded the ship while on the brink of being forced into marriage by her family, and was stopped from killing herself by a penniless artist. She fell in love with her saviour, but the disaster on the horizon meant their time together was doomed to be short. James Cameron's Oscar-winning romantic drama, starring Kate Winslet, Leonardo DiCaprio, Billy Zane, Kathy Bates and Bill Paxton.(n)

programme.title: Colombiana

Years later, she is still working for him as an assassin, but is secretly planning to avenge her parents' deaths. Action thriller, starring Zoe Saldana, Cliff Curtis, Michael Vartan and Lennie James.(n)
