programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Tug of War Rope.
programme.desc: The Pirates and the Ninjas line-up for the tug of war contest in Daredale, but the rope snaps, leaving Noddy to find out who cut it.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Ryder and the Paw Patrol team help to rescue a lost kitten, but the feline causes mayhem.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Nanny is magically frozen after being rude to a witch in the forest, leaving Ben and Holly to find a way to thaw her out.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: Grizel falls into a trap she was making for Digby and cannot climb out, so Mungo tries to get some rope to rescue her without telling the others.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Miss Rabbit takes Peppa and her family for a ride in a rescue helicopter.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The piglet teaches her visiting baby cousin Alexander his first word.(n)

programme.title: Wissper
programme.desc: Monty the Meerkat asks Wissper for help, but he does not seem too sure what his problem is.(n)

programme.title: Toot the Tiny Tugboat
programme.desc: Ken Toyn's plans to build a floating workshop for his holiday project suffer a setback when some seals decide to use it as their new home.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and the panel debate the day's issues before opening the discussion to the studio audience and inviting viewers to call in or text their opinions.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Ameet Tailor lends his expertise to Daniel, a 20-something self-confessed cannabis addict who has become frustrated by his inability to kick the habit. It is up to Dr Ameet to calm his patient and get him into rehab. Dr David Ward deals with angry Irishman David, who arrives on crutches and with an injured hand following a fight. David is furious with the council, and is taking a distinctly negative approach to life, so the doctor suggests he tackle his problems one at a time. Finally, nurse Sheila Wellavise helps cheerful patient Mario, who almost cut off the end of his finger while using a circular saw while doing a spot of DIY.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: Britain's Got Talent 2014 finalists the Addict Initiative help Jon Bentley test the latest wireless earbuds in an extreme dance routine. Georgie Barrat continues to help struggling football team Monkey Tree FC using technology to focus on potential diet and nutrition wins, while Ortis Deley hears about quantum computers which it's suggested will be millions, billions, or even trillions of times faster than current technology.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Zac tells Sam she should leave Summer Bay immediately, Hunter is devastated to see the growing bond between Mason and Olivia and Luc's baby blessing goes disastrously wrong.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: David follows a series of clues that he thinks will lead him to his father, Leo and Amy struggle to hide their feelings for each other, while tension rises between Finn and Elly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is found murdered and Gibbs and McGee are called in when she is discovered to be carrying ID bearing the name Sgt Patricia Moreno, a US marine known to have died several years earlier. The victim is discovered to have come to America from Afghanistan and a necklace reveals a fingerprint that leads the team to a known assassin. Guest starring Lolita Davidovich.(n)

programme.title: Signed, Sealed, Delivered
programme.sub-title: Lost Letter Mysteries: From the Heart.
programme.desc: Premiere. The Postables discover a 200-year-old Valentine that could change history, while their investigation of a damaged letter leads to a public figure who could be brought down by its contents. The aftermath of Valentine's Day sees Oliver, Shane, Norman and Rita each dealing with heartbreaking circumstances. Drama, starring Eric Mabius, Kristin Booth and Geoff Gustafson.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: David follows a series of clues that he thinks will lead him to his father, Leo and Amy struggle to hide their feelings for each other, while tension rises between Finn and Elly.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Zac tells Sam she should leave Summer Bay immediately, Hunter is devastated to see the growing bond between Mason and Olivia and Luc's baby blessing goes disastrously wrong.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: The Gadget Show
programme.desc: Craig Charles puts some state-of-the-art headphones to the test. These wireless units incorporate a voice-controlled smart assistant and a fitness tracker, all for £99. Jon Bentley dials up Chinese smartphone the Huawei Honor 6X to see if it is actually better than its more established rivals - and at a fraction of current prices. Plus, Georgie Barrat gets exclusive access to the New York Toy Fair, to check out latest tech playthings that will hit the shops in a few months' time.(n)

programme.title: Tony Robinson: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: The presenter visits Eden Valley, Cumbria, where he makes a dramatic ascent to the limestone-paved Great Asby Scar, the last evidence of a 300 million-year-old tropical sea. Smardale Gill viaduct has Tony marvelling at its engineering genius, before he investigates the 21st-century technology driving a traditional dairy. The actor and history buff gets a masterclass working with border collie sheepdogs before heading to Nine Standards Rigg, a summit high on the backbone of Britain, where he contemplates the origins of the huge drystone cairns that dominate the skyline.(n)

programme.title: Spectacular Spain with Alex Polizzi
programme.desc: The hotelier and presenter shares her passion for Spain's culture and people, and makes some new discoveries along the way. She begins in the north east, a region often overlooked by Brits, where she enjoys a luxurious cabernet grape body scrub, and is shown around an astonishing cellar full of ancient wines. Alex experiences the craziness of the San Fermin fiesta, including the legendary running of the bulls through the streets of Pamplona, before heading to Barcelona - Spain's second largest city - famous for its vibrant, cosmopolitan character, and abundance of art and architecture.(n)

programme.title: Michael Jackson: Man in the Mirror
programme.desc: Profile of the singer, following his development from child star with the Jackson 5 to becoming an iconic performer in his own right as an adult. The programme explores his difficult relationship with his family and makes the case that growing up in the public eye had a devastating psychological impact that he was never able to recover from.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: Rich and Acquitted
programme.desc: The singer's 2005 trial on charges of child molestation, which concluded with him being found not guilty on all charges. Featuring in-depth interviews from Jackson's attorneys and the prosecution, who discuss the circumstances of the case and the factors that led to the prosecution case collapsing.(n)

programme.title: All New Traffic Cops
programme.sub-title: All New Traffic Cops: Under Attack.
programme.desc: A high-speed chase in Bradford is ended when CS gas is used to bring a determined speeder to justice, while teams are out on quiet back roads as they track two cars that are thought to be connected with various firearms offences. Plus, burglars find out they cannot outrun the cops when weighed down with a quad bike and trailing a cloud of cannabis behind them.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice helps a Staffordshire couple sell their three-bedroom house in Newcastle-under-Lyme by clearing clutter and creating more space. Her efforts pay off, and with fresher shades on the walls and a laminated floor, they soon find a buyer for the property.(n)

programme.title: HouseBusters
programme.desc: Janet Ellis invites three experts to `heal' a house that is making its inhabitants unhappy. The team diagnoses a troubled house belonging to a middle-aged couple in Watford.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: Newly hatched ducklings are rescued from a drain, and the vets perform the first known CT scan on a badger.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The family follows a nature trail in the countryside, discovering footprints left by little birds and ants.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The cheeky piglet has a new pen pal, a little donkey from France, called Delphine.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: The inquisitive puppet's friends are playing ball games and Monkey is brilliant at kicking, but needs a little help with catching.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Bop Box
programme.desc: Derek Moran, Jen Pringle and Olivia Birchenough race to the rescue as a police officer, paramedic and firefighter.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Ryder, Rubble and Rocky call in Chase to help them free Katie and Cali's train from a landslide.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are building an elephant statue when Muck accidentally damages it - and is nervous about owning up to his mistake.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The hero must save Norman and James, who get stuck up a tree while trying to rescue their model airplane.(n)

programme.title: Rupert Bear
programme.desc: Miranda finds life at Rocky Bay boring and decides she would like to explore Nutwood.(n)

programme.title: Olly the Little White Van
programme.desc: When Bumpton Radio goes off the air because of an accident, Olly takes DJ Dawn around Bumpton for a radio roadshow.(n)

programme.title: Wanda and the Alien
programme.desc: Daddy needs some honey to make a cake, so Wanda and Alien go looking for some. They meet a queen bee who has lost all her workers.(n)

programme.title: Angelina Ballerina
programme.sub-title: Angelina and the Front Row Ticket.
programme.desc: Angelina has an extra ticket to see Tchaikovsky's The Nutcracker, but invites two of her friends by mistake. She decides to miss the show, but luckily Dad arrives with a last-minute surprise.(n)

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The youngster is in for a shock after resolving to win all the games she plays. Narrated by Julian Clary.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Ryder, Chase and Rubble use their dance moves to help repair the tracks before the next train arrives.(n)

programme.title: Blaze and the Monster Machines
programme.desc: Darrington is set to appear in a monster truck show, but Crusher tries to take his place by building a machine that leaves him stranded on the top of a mountain.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: Noddy and the Case of the Disappearing Rainbow.
programme.desc: Somebody is causing all the accidents in Toyland, and Noddy tries to find out who before something gets broken for good.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly, Ben and the Wise Old Elf play a trick on Nanny Plum.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: Part one of two. The story of how Leah first met Shimmer and Shine, after she won a mysterious bottle pendant at a carnival.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George and Peppa help Granny and Grandpa Pig clean out their attic.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa falls out with her best friend Suzy Sheep.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The king comes to visit, but Nanny accidentally shrinks all his clothes - and has to make some more using vegetables from the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
programme.desc: The team faces Stockman-Fly's new insect minions, and Raph has to man up to overcome his fear of insects and lead the team.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors: Takedown with Vinnie Jones
programme.desc: Vinnie Jones introduces clips of exciting police chases, as elite pursuit units crack down on law-breakers on the highways and byways of Britain.(n)

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A foul-mouthed pensioner pushes Barry's patience to the limit, Sarah gives a bad-boy biker an early birthday present and Jim's Audi S3 is outclassed by a car 30 years its senior. Plus, Mike is left open-mouthed when he encounters a drink-driver who is three times over the limit.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on four single parents struggling to provide for their children while living on state welfare. Lauren dreams of a career in the Army, where she would get help with childcare, and 40-year-old Joanne is struggling to heat the home she shares with her eight-year-old daughter. Craig has only recently taken sole responsibility for his daughter after the end of his relationship, while clairvoyant and mother-of-six Sue is planing a council house swap - but competition is fierce.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Life on the Dole.
programme.desc: The documentary about living on benefits meets people struggling to survive island life. They include Tina, who is struggling to cope on the Isle of Sheppey in Kent - despite turning her life around and kicking her heroin habit, she is now finding life on the island tough thanks to her mobility problems. Single parent Matt lives in Cowes on the Isle of Wight, where the lack of jobs makes life a constant struggle, while Chrissy on Canvey Island in Essex is refusing to pay her rent as she believes her home is not up to scratch. As a result, however, she is facing eviction.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: Women who claim benefits while looking after several children. They include Chesterfield mum Maria, who has five kids to five different dads and has not worked since 2002. She is so desperate to get off benefits she has signed herself up to the same college course as her daughter. Birmingham woman Karen has six children and a seventh on the way with partner Ashleigh - and although his job search is not going well he keeps himself busy in other ways. In Weymouth, Kate picks up almost £30,000 a year in benefits to supplement her husband Ian's income as a taxi driver - and spends more than £170 a month of this on pocket money for her seven kids.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: A woman owes five months' rent, but refuses to leave unless the bailiffs arrive, while a man wanted to sell his house post-breakup, but the tenants are still there five years later. Plus, a man happily living in his garden shed.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: A landlord seeks urgent advice from eviction specialist Chris after finding his three-bedroom terrace has been stripped bare of the fittings, the flooring, and even the grass on the lawn. A landlady gets a shock when she finally gains access to her property, a couple living in America are owed £10,000 in rent from a house in the UK, and Dave from Peterborough Council's housing team comes across some of the worst damp and mould he has ever seen.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Paul and Ben face a challenging eviction in London, where a vulnerable tenant in rent arrears has barricaded her front door, and the agents receive a tirade of abuse. Meanwhile, Brian and Del chase a debt of nearly £2,000 in Surrey, before trying to recover almost £3,000 in Northamptonshire. Finally, Steve and Ru head to Portsmouth to evict a young family for a landlord who wants her property back.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The officers chase a debt of almost £2,000 in unpaid parking fines, and later encounter the extraordinary case of a debt of £80,000 owed by a hotel owner to his ex-girlfriend. However, as they begin to search the property, they call upon police back-up as the agents fear the debtor may have access to firearms. Elsewhere, two officers head to a car garage in Manchester where the owner owes £2,000 after losing a court case over a faulty vehicle.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates when two pharmaceutical executives are murdered, uncovering a criminal who changes his identity for each offence he commits, and has evaded capture across several countries. To make matters worse, the agents are made to feel the pressure by the watchful eye of Granger. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell and Miguel Ferrer.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A deep-sea diver is murdered on the job, and his co-workers all become suspects. However, when they return to the surface, they must remain in a high-tech decompression chamber for four days. With each of their suspects confined within a tank, the NCIS team must complete an unorthodox investigation from the outside. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Football on 5: The Championship
programme.desc: George Riley and Lynsey Hipgrave introduce highlights from the weekend's games in the Championship, including Barnsley v Sheffield Wednesday at Oakwell and Newcastle United v Wigan Athletic at St James' Park. Plus, the best of the action from Reading v Leeds United at the Madejski Stadium and Huddersfield Town v Burton Albion at the John Smith's Stadium.(n)

programme.title: Football on 5: Goal Rush
programme.desc: George Riley and Lynsey Hipgrave introduce all the goals from the latest games in Leagues One and Two, including Bolton Wanderers v Chesterfield and Grimsby Town v Doncaster Rovers.(n)

programme.title: FIA Formula E Live
programme.desc: The Mexico City ePrix. Coverage of the fourth round of the campaign from the Autodromo Hermanos Rodriguez in Mexico. This track has held numerous races from Formula 1 to the World Endurance Championship during its illustrious history and many different configurations. A new 2.1km layout was created for the arrival of Formula E in 2016, and at more than 2500m, the track is the highest in Formula E - and one of the highest in the world.(n)

programme.title: Our Brand Is Crisis
programme.desc: This satirical comedy starring Sandra Bullock as a political consultant gives viewers an inside look at the high-stakes, win-at-all-costs world of politics. Bullock stars as "Calamity" Jane Bodine, who is hired to work on the campaign of a Bolivian presidential candidate who has fallen behind in the polls. She faces off against her rival Pat Candy (Billy Bob Thornton), who is working on the opponent's campaign and is also looking for every opportunity to antagonize Jane. The film is loosely based on the 2005 documentary of the same name by Rachel Boynton. Directed by David Gordon Green (Pineapple Express, George Washington). Produced by Oscar-winners George Clooney and Grant Heslov(n)

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: Director Roger Michell follows up the hit romantic comedy Notting Hill with this thought-provoking thriller. Ben Affleck and Samuel L. Jackson star, respectively, as Gavin Banek and Doyle Gibson, two New York men whose lives become accidentally intertwined in a Good Friday fender bender on the FDR Drive. Late for a crucial appointment, hotshot lawyer Gavin tosses Doyle a blank check and leaves the scene, while Doyle, whose car is inoperable, is late for a court-appointed custody hearing. A recovering alcoholic, Doyle's tardiness doesn't sit well with the judge, who - sick of waiting for Gipson - grants custody to Doyle's ex-wife in Doyle's absence. The situation worsens when it becomes evident that Doyle has an equally important file belonging to Gavin, which proves that an elderly man gave Banek's firm power-of-attorney over his foundation. So begins an escalating war of words and deeds between the two men. Soon, egged on by an associate, Gavin hires a "fixer" to destroy Doyle's credit, forcing Doyle to fire back with some cunning moves of his own(n)

programme.title: The Winning Season
programme.desc: A man (Sam Rockwell) attempts to pull his life together by teaching his daughter's (Emma Roberts) high-school basketball team in this indie comedy by Grace Is Gone writer/director James C. Strouse. Rob Corddry co-stars in this Gigi/Plum Pictures production(n)

programme.title: Not Another Teen Movie
programme.desc: At John Hughes High School aspiring artist Janey Briggs is an outcast because of her plain, bespectacled looks and paint-splattered overalls. Football hero Jake Wyler makes a bet that he can transform Janey into a gorgeous prom queen, a wager he may come to regret as he discovers Janey's true inner beauty(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: In this adventure docudrama set in 1996, several groups of climbers successfully scale Mount Everest, only to be faced with tragedy when a monster snowstorm surprises them as they attempt to make their descent(n)

programme.title: Pearl Harbor
programme.desc: News of the death of air ace Rafe reaches his sweetheart, who starts to fall for his best pal. Rafe shows up alive in Hawaii, but the trio's problems look miniscule in comparison to the devastation wreaked by the Japanese on Pearl Harbor. Romance set against a blockbuster backdrop with the biggest budget ever footed by a single studio(n)

programme.title: True Story
programme.desc: A disgraced journalist plays a game of cat and mouse with an accused murderer who assumed his identity while on the run(n)

programme.title: Last Man Standing
programme.desc: Prohibition-era action drama about a feared gunslinger who cruises into a Texan border town and finds himself caught in the middle of a gang war. With loyalties to no one but himself, he seizes the chance to play the bootlegging Irish and Italian gangs against each other to his own advantage(n)

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: Leonardo DiCaprio plays aCIA agent on the ground in Jordan, chasing a powerful terrorist leader(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: In this harrowing historical drama set in the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship the Essex struggle to survive after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: Tom Cruise returns as both producer and agent Ethan Hunt in his second action-adventure adaptation of the television series. Directed by John Woo, the action speeds across the continents, as Ethan accepts his latest mission: retrieve and destroy the supply of a genetically modified disease called Chimera, as well as recover the cure, Bellerophon, from of a group of terrorists led by Sean Ambrose. For the mission to succeed, Ethan must persuade jewel thief Nyah Hall to join him, which he does by nearly running her car off a cliff. When Nyah becomes infected with the disease, Ethan must battle to save the woman he now loves, even if that means sending her into enemy territory, and the hands of her ex-boyfriend. Also starring Ving Rhames. Edited for violence and language(n)

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: Randall "Memphis" Raines, a retired car thief, is drawn back into action when a crime lord threatens to whack Raines' brother unless the thief steals 50 top-model cars within 72 hours. Raines recruits a crew of fellow carjackers, including an old pro and an old flame, and the race is on(n)

programme.title: Monster's Ball
programme.desc: An Oscar-winning Halle Berry stars as the Death Row widow who shares her grief and her bed with prison guard Billy Bob Thornton. Powerful drama with Heath Ledger(n)

programme.title: The Arrival
programme.desc: Astronomer Zane discovers an alien radio signal and when he tries to report it he unearths a sinister conspiracy(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
programme.desc: Comic road movie starring Wesley Snipes and Patrick Swayze about three New York drag queens who win a trip to Hollywood and set out on a life-changing journey across the USA(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: Best friends Liv and Emma discover their dream weddings have been booked at the same venue on the same date and an epic catfight ensues(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: In an effort to recapture their youth, three disillusioned men start a frat house, then run afoul of the dean. Luke Wilson and Will Ferrell star in this uneven "Animal House" rip-off from director Todd Phillips, who co-wrote the script(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: A failed actor turned drama teacher attempts to make a splash by staging a controversial sequel to William Shakespeare's Hamlet. Comedy(n)

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: Jamie Foxx stars as Nathaniel Ayers, a former violin prodigy whose bouts with schizophrenia landed him on the streets after two years of schooling at Juilliard. Steve Lopez is a disenchanted journalist dealing with a recent divorce. Steve is wandering through Los Angeles' Skid Row when he spots Ayers. The more Steve learns about Ayers, the more he longs to help the troubled soul(n)

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: A woman on the lam with her young daughter takes drastic steps when her abusive husband tracks them down(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: The third entry in the popular pulp-adventure series finds Rick O'Connell and wife, Evelyn, in 1940s China with their now-adult son, Alex . Together they battle a centuries-old Chinese emperor and his undead army(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: A lab-created human/alien hybrid goes on a killing spree while searching for a man who can impregnate her. Meanwhile, the scientist responsible for her creation brings together a motley crew in order to stop her(n)

programme.title: Species II
programme.desc: A trio of American astronauts become instant heroes as they plant the Stars and Stripes on Mars before beginning the voyage home. But back on their ship, something else has set its sights on Earth... something whose relatives have already paid us a visit(n)

programme.title: Species: The Awakening
programme.desc: Miranda, a beautiful college professor, awakens from a blackout and is surrounded by dead bodies. She learns she is an alien/ human hybrid, and must travel to Mexico to find her creator before she can no longer contain her lethal urges(n)

programme.title: Magnolia
programme.desc: P.T. Anderson's (Boogie Nights) wonderful ensemble drama with Tom Cruise (nominated for an Oscar), Philip Baker Hall, Philip Seymour Hoffman, William H. Macy, Julianne Moore, John C. Reilly all looking for meaning and happiness in the Valley(n)

programme.title: Our Brand Is Crisis
programme.desc: This satirical comedy starring Sandra Bullock as a political consultant gives viewers an inside look at the high-stakes, win-at-all-costs world of politics. programme.desc: Leonardo DiCaprio plays aCIA agent on the ground in Jordan, chasing a powerful terrorist leader(n)

programme.title: In the Heart of the Sea
programme.desc: In this harrowing historical drama set in the winter of 1820, the crew of the New England whaling ship the Essex struggle to survive after an attack by a rogue sperm whale leaves them stranded at sea for 90 days(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: Tom Cruise returns as both producer and agent Ethan Hunt in his second action-adventure adaptation of the television series. Directed by John Woo, the action speeds across the continents, as Ethan accepts his latest mission: retrieve and destroy the supply of a genetically modified disease called Chimera, as well as recover the cure, Bellerophon, from of a group of terrorists led by Sean Ambrose. For the mission to succeed, Ethan must persuade jewel thief Nyah Hall to join him, which he does by nearly running her car off a cliff. When Nyah becomes infected with the disease, Ethan must battle to save the woman he now loves, even if that means sending her into enemy territory, and the hands of her ex-boyfriend. Also starring Ving Rhames. Edited for violence and language(n)

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: Randall "Memphis" Raines, a retired car thief, is drawn back into action when a crime lord threatens to whack Raines' brother unless the thief steals 50 top-model cars within 72 hours. Raines recruits a crew of fellow carjackers, including an old pro and an old flame, and the race is on(n)

programme.title: Monster's Ball
programme.desc: An Oscar-winning Halle Berry stars as the Death Row widow who shares her grief and her bed with prison guard Billy Bob Thornton. Powerful drama with Heath Ledger(n)

programme.title: The Arrival
programme.desc: Astronomer Zane discovers an alien radio signal and when he tries to report it he unearths a sinister conspiracy(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
programme.desc: Comic road movie starring Wesley Snipes and Patrick Swayze about three New York drag queens who win a trip to Hollywood and set out on a life-changing journey across the USA(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: Brett Ratner's martial-arts action-comedy sequel starring Chris Tucker and Jackie Chan. When the Chinese Ambassador to the US is shot while in the act of divulging the whereabouts of a major Triad leader, the American authorities once more send Chief Inspector Lee and Detective James Carter into the fray. Lee quickly corners the would-be assassin, Kenji, but the shock of coming face-to-face with an old friend gives the baddie just enough time to escape. Kenji's trail leads the mismatched cops to Paris, where car chases and a sequence among the under-dressed dancers of the Folies Bergère await them, plus rather a lot of dodgy French stereotypes and a finale atop the Eiffel Tower(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: Best friends Liv and Emma discover their dream weddings have been booked at the same venue on the same date and an epic catfight ensues(n)

programme.title: Old School

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: A failed actor turned drama teacher attempts to make a splash by staging a controversial sequel to William Shakespeare's Hamlet. Comedy(n)

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: Jamie Foxx stars as Nathaniel Ayers, a former violin prodigy whose bouts with schizophrenia landed him on the streets after two years of schooling at Juilliard. Steve Lopez is a disenchanted journalist dealing with a recent divorce. Steve is wandering through Los Angeles' Skid Row when he spots Ayers. The more Steve learns about Ayers, the more he longs to help the troubled soul(n)

programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: The documentary explores the intelligence of marine mammals, discovering just how smart whales and dolphins really are. Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: Lost Land of the Tiger
programme.desc: From the base camp in the Himalayas, the team moves out to track down tigers throughout Bhutan. Steve Backshall is pushed to the limits of his physical endurance when he takes on a white-water river in the eastern jungles, and Gordon Buchanan deploys remote cameras and uses a fingerprinting technique to identify individual cats. Meanwhile, biologist Dr George McGavin meets the predator during a trip to India.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team explores Ireland's west coast, journeying between Galway Bay and Fastnet Rock, the country's southernmost point. Neil Oliver discovers how flotsam washed up on the Galway shoreline inspired Christopher Columbus's journey to America, while Alice Roberts explores the botanical puzzle of the Burren in Co Clare and travels to the monastery on the island of Skellig Michael.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: Swallowed by a Black Hole.
programme.desc: Documentary examining what would happen to a gas cloud that strayed within the gravitational reach of a supermassive black hole in the centre of the Milky Way. Across the globe, telescopes were trained on the heart of Earth's galaxy in the expectation of observing the cosmic spectacle for the first time in history.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants

Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: Sharks of the Mediterranean
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the lives of the many sharks that inhabit the sea, which include the great white, tiger and hammerhead.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

Neil Oliver discovers how flotsam washed up on the Galway shoreline inspired Christopher Columbus's journey to America, while Alice Roberts explores the botanical puzzle of the Burren in Co Clare and travels to the monastery on the island of Skellig Michael.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Dog's Best Friend
programme.desc: Looking at canines' friendships with other creatures from the animal world.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Horizon: What on Earth Is Wrong with Gravity?.
programme.desc: Physicist Dr Brian Cox tries to solve the centuries-old mystery of gravity. Unconventionally competing with Newton and Einstein, he starts in Texas, firing a laser at the moon, before moving on to a sat-nav in Denver and a Louisiana swamp. The real issues are in the area of quantum physics for, as he discovers, that is the science of absolutely everything.(n)

programme.title: Finding Life Beyond Earth
programme.desc: Part one of two. Recent telescope images are combined with CGI technology to illustrate the sights and sounds of alien worlds. Powerful modern telescopes and unmanned space missions have revealed a wide range of dynamic environments, prompting scientists to expand their ideas about the possibility that life may be present elsewhere in the solar system.(n)

programme.title: Finding Life Beyond Earth
programme.desc: Conclusion. Foremost astrobiologists explain how the latest telescope images and feedback from unmanned space missions are extending the possibility that life may exist elsewhere in the solar system.(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Continents
programme.desc: Geologist Professor Iain Stewart examines key moments in the development of the world's major land masses. He begins by looking at how Africa was formed from the wreckage of a long-lost supercontinent, with its landmarks, mineral wealth and wildlife providing clues that help piece together the story of its creation. He also reveals how this deep history has left its mark on modern day Africa and the world.(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Continents
programme.desc: Iain Stewart examines Australia and reveals how its formation and development has affected everything from Aboriginal history to modern-day mining, and even the evolution of its unique wildlife. He travels to the Great Australian Bight to show how the country was once joined to Antarctica, and how the koala's big, round face and fluffy ears are a result of adaptations to the change of climate after the two land masses split.(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Continents
programme.desc: Iain Stewart examines clues hidden in the landscape to reveal how the Americas were formed from an ancient supercontinent, later named Pangaea. He finds evidence that 300 million years ago New York was at the heart of a huge mountain range, and travels to an extinct volcano in Bolivia to explore subduction - the process that has shaped South America.(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Continents
programme.desc: Iain Stewart examines key moments in the development of Eurasia, which is the combined continental land mass of Europe and Asia and was formed by a series of tectonic-plate collisions over millions of years. In Kerala, a freshwater fish provides evidence that Madagascar was once joined to India, which created the Himalayas as it pushed its way 4,000km north to its present position.(n)

programme.title: The Natural
programme.desc: Robert Redford in the Bernard Malamud saga of a baseball player with magic in his bat(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Emotions run wild in the mind of a young girl who is uprooted from her peaceful life in the Midwest and forced to move to San Francisco. Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness each have their own ideas about how she should handle her new surroundings(n)

programme.title: Dan in Real Life
programme.desc: A widowed advice columnist who is struggling to raise three daughters falls in love with a French beauty---unaware she is his brother's girlfriend. Steve Carell ("The Office") and Juliette Binoche star in this charming romantic comedy. Dane Cook, Alison Pill, Brittany Robertson, Marlene Lawston. Directed by Peter Hedges(n)

programme.title: The Ghost and the Darkness
programme.desc: Set in 1898, this movie is based on the true story of two lions in Africa that killed 130 people over a nine month period, while a bridge engineer and an experienced old hunter tried to kill them(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Emotions run wild in the mind of a young girl who is uprooted from her peaceful life in the Midwest and forced to move to San Francisco. Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness each have their own ideas about how she should handle her new surroundings(n)

programme.title: The Rainmaker
programme.desc: A naive young lawyer and his experienced partner take on a corrupt insurance company in the court case of a lifetime(n)

programme.title: Enchanted
programme.desc: In Enchanted, a classic Disney fairytale collides with modern-day New York City. An inspiring story about a fairytale princess who is sent to our world by an evil queen. Soon after her arrival, Princess Giselle begins to change her views on life and love after meeting a handsome lawyer. Can a storybook view of romance survive in the real world?(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Emotions run wild in the mind of a young girl who is uprooted from her peaceful life in the Midwest and forced to move to San Francisco. Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness each have their own ideas about how she should handle her new surroundings(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
programme.desc: In the final instalment of the buccaneering trilogy, Jack Sparrow is trapped in Davy Jones's Locker, and in his absence the East India Trading Company is taking over the seas. Jack's former crew and his friends Elizabeth and Will must join forces with Captain Barbossa to save Captain Sparrow and bring the entire pirate community together against their common enemy. The scene is set for a high-seas battle of epic proportions(n)

programme.title: Godzilla
programme.desc: Blockbuster monster movie with spectacular special effects by the director of 'Independence Day'. Following a bizarre attack on a Japanese fishing vessel and sightings of a strange dinosaur-like creature, scientist Dr Nick Tatopoulos (Matthew Broderick) suspects that radiation from nuclear weapons testing in French Polynesia may have caused a genetic mutation in the local lizard population. The path of destruction leads north, to New York. Will the combined forces of US military be enough to save the city from devastation?(n)

programme.title: Predator
programme.desc: This 1987 release sees Arnold Schwarzenegger in a familiar role as the action hero leading a team of CIA hired mercenaries into the Central American jungle to take on an alien force. Guess who has to do it all on his own in the end?(n)

programme.title: Signs
programme.desc: As alien beings threaten Earth's cities, former preacher Graham Hess and his family retreat into their farmhouse and prepare for a very close encounter(n)

programme.title: Tomorrowland
programme.desc: The walls of time and space break down in this rollicking sci-fi adventure, in which an ambitious teen discovers a pin that transports her to a futuristic world. She then teams up with a jaded genius, and they embark on a mission to save the Earth(n)

programme.title: Down to You
programme.desc: Whimsical romantic comedy about two college students, Al and Imogen, who fall in love. However, a youthful fear of commitment threatens to destabilise their romance, and when Imogen gets an opportunity to study elsewhere, Al breaks up the relationship - only to realise that he has made a huge mistake(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
programme.desc: In the final instalment of the buccaneering trilogy, Jack Sparrow is trapped in Davy Jones's Locker, and in his absence the East India Trading Company is taking over the seas. The scene is set for a high-seas battle of epic proportions(n)

programme.title: Tomorrowland

programme.title: Rocky
programme.desc: Uplifting, Oscar-winning drama about a small-time boxer from Philadelphia who - against all odds - gets a shot at his ultimate dream, the heavyweight championship of the world(n)

programme.title: Rocky II
programme.desc: Sequel to the 1976 Oscar-winning favourite which catapulted Sylvester Stallone to megastardom. Things are looking grim for Philadelphia boxer Rocky Balboa. His wife is in a post-natal coma and he has an eye injury that could cost him his sight. But heavyweight champion Apollo Creed's pride is still smarting from their first bout, and he wants a rematch with the Italian Stallion(n)

programme.title: Rocky III
programme.desc: After suffering a humiliating defeat at the hands of hungry young boxer Clubber Lang, Rocky is rejuvenated by his former rival Apollo Creed, who trains Rocky for a rematch against the fearsome mohawked rival, and helps him regain "the eye of the tiger."(n)

programme.title: Rocky IV
programme.desc: Rocky packs another punch in a bout against a Soviet named Drago(n)

programme.title: Rocky V
programme.desc: Touted upon its release as the finale of the Rocky saga, this fifth entry in the long-running series of sports dramas reunites star Sylvester Stallone with John G. Avildsen, director of the Oscar-winning original. Stallone is Rocky Balboa, suffering from career-ending brain damage as a result of his punishing bout with Ivan Drago at the finale of the previous film. Upon their return to Philadelphia, Rocky and his wife, Adrian (Talia Shire), discover they are broke, their fortune squandered by an incompetent accountant. Forced to move back to their working-class neighborhood, Rocky finds that his only asset is the run-down gym willed to him by Mickey (Burgess Meredith, who appears in new flashback sequences). Resisting big money offered to him by Don King-like boxing promoter George Washington Duke (Richard Gant), Rocky becomes a trainer and finds a talented comer in Tommy Gunn (real-life boxer Tommy Morrison, nephew of John Wayne). Rocky's son (played by Stallone's real-life son Sage Stallone) feels neglected by his father, who lavishes attention on his protégé, but Tommy ultimately turns his back on his mentor to sign a more lucrative deal with Duke, leading to a street-fight showdown(n)

programme.title: Rocky
programme.desc: Uplifting, Oscar-winning drama about a small-time boxer from Philadelphia who - against all odds - gets a shot at his ultimate dream, the heavyweight championship of the world(n)

programme.title: Rocky II
programme.desc: Sequel to the 1976 Oscar-winning favourite which catapulted Sylvester Stallone to megastardom. Things are looking grim for Philadelphia boxer Rocky Balboa. His wife is in a post-natal coma and he has an eye injury that could cost him his sight. But heavyweight champion Apollo Creed's pride is still smarting from their first bout, and he wants a rematch with the Italian Stallion(n)

programme.title: Traitor
programme.desc: An undercover CIA agent within a terrorist cell is marked as a terrorist suspect by the FBI in Overture Films' upcoming thriller Traitor. Don Cheadle produces and stars in the film as the operative under Guy Pearce's investigation. Based on an idea by Steve Martin, the film is written and directed by Day After Tomorrow screenwriter Jeffrey Nachmanoff(n)

programme.title: The Anomaly
programme.desc: Noel Clarke stars as an ex-soldier who must fight to discover why he is only conscious for bursts of nine minutes and 47 seconds(n)

programme.title: Undercover Brother
programme.desc: Undercover Brother is recruited by the secret organisation called the B.R.O.T.H.E.R.H.O.O.D. to foil the attempts of The Man to destroy racial unity(n)

programme.title: Billionaire Ransom
programme.desc: A team of kidnappers take hostages at an island boot camp for spoiled rich kids, but the youths eventually decide to work together and fight back(n)

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: In this sprawling epic about America, a young man in 1860s New York City seeks to avenge his father's death decades earlier at the hands of a hardened gang leader during a large skirmish between warring clans. He befriends the brutal crime lord, gaining his trust in order to get close enough to exact revenge(n)

programme.title: Pineapple Express
programme.desc: A lazy stoner is the sole witness to a murder by an evil drug lord and a corrupt cop. Marked for death, he runs for his life, dragging his dazed dealer and his supplier with him on a hilarious pot-fueled adventure(n)

programme.title: Traitor
programme.desc: An undercover CIA agent within a terrorist cell is marked as a terrorist suspect by the FBI in Overture Films' upcoming thriller Traitor. Don Cheadle produces and stars in the film as the operative under Guy Pearce's investigation. Based on an idea by Steve Martin, the film is written and directed by Day After Tomorrow screenwriter Jeffrey Nachmanoff(n)

programme.title: Diary of a Hitman
programme.desc: Tense thriller based on a play starring Forest Whitaker, Sherilyn Fenn, James Belushi, Sharon Stone. the longer a hitman waits, the harder the hit becomes(n)

programme.title: The Siege
programme.desc: When a series of bombs is set off in the heart of New York, FBI agent Anthony Hubbard investigates. As martial law is declared and the troops move in, have the terrorists already won? Action(n)

programme.title: Pineapple Express
programme.desc: A lazy stoner is the sole witness to a murder by an evil drug lord and a corrupt cop. Marked for death, he runs for his life, dragging his dazed dealer and his supplier with him on a hilarious pot-fueled adventure(n)

programme.title: Gangs of New York
programme.desc: In this sprawling epic about America, a young man in 1860s New York City seeks to avenge his father's death decades earlier at the hands of a hardened gang leader during a large skirmish between warring clans. He befriends the brutal crime lord, gaining his trust in order to get close enough to exact revenge(n)

programme.title: Godzilla 2000
programme.desc: Following Roland Emmerich's controversial Americanization of the Japanese monster icon in Godzilla (1998), the Beast from the East comes roaring back in this sci-fi adventure tale. Yuji Shinoda (Naomi Nishida), a scientist devoted to researching Godzilla, is setting up equipment on a fog-shrouded peninsula with her daughter Io (Mayu Suzuki) and journalist Yuki Ichinose (Takehiro Murata) when everyone's favorite 180-foot-tall lizard appears from the sea and begins laying siege to a nuclear power plant. The military swings into action, but the monster's fiery breath soon uncovers an alien spacecraft; beings from outer space have come to take over the earth, and now Godzilla is our last line of defense against them. Hugely successful in Japan, Gojira Mireniamu (aka Godzilla 2000) was the first Japanese Godzilla movie since Godzilla 1985 to receive a US theatrical release(n)

programme.title: Godzilla vs. Megaguirus
programme.desc: The Big Green Guy launches yet another attack on Japan, but this time the humans are prepared for him---though not for the arrival of a second monster. Misato Tanaka, Shosuki Tanihara. Motohiko: Masato Ibu. Yoshino: Yuriko Hoshi(n)

programme.title: Godzilla, Mothra and King Ghidorah: Giant Monsters All-Out Attack
programme.desc: After sandblasting away years of camp and bad scripts from the Gamera franchise to form a couple of tight-scripted, vastly entertaining flicks, Shusuke Kaneko gives the same treatment to the granddaddy of kaiju eiga characters: Godzilla. The film opens with Godzilla waking up from his underwater hideaway. Unseen since his 1954 attack on Tokyo, the monster is spotted by a Japanese submarine. Though government officials seem reluctant to confront the problem, Navy Admiral Tachibana (Ryudo Uzaki), who witnessed the rampage when he was a child, is more than a little alarmed. Meanwhile, Tachibana's daughter Yuri (Chiharu Niiyama), who works at a struggling TV station, is making a documentary in the mountains of Niigata Prefecture. One night, they experience a massive earthquake and that next morning they learn that a gang of motorcycle punks were crushed in a mountain tunnel and witnesses reportedly saw some sort of fire-breathing creature in the rubble. Later, a group of campers in southern Kagoshima prefecture are crushed by some Thing that crawled out of Lake Ikeda. Soon Japan is awash with monsters -- including Baradon, a monster that looks like a pug terrier with Mickey Mouse ears, and King Gidora, a three-headed beast with a lethal 50-meter tail -- busting up things north, south, east, and west(n)

programme.title: Godzilla Against Mechagodzilla
programme.desc: A Japanese scientist (Shin Takuma) creates a giant cyborg creature to do battle with the prehistoric beast. Yumiko Shaku. Directed by Masaaki Tezuka(n)

programme.title: Godzilla: Tokyo S.O.S.
programme.desc: Masaki Tezuka directs his third thrilling installment in the ongoing saga of the monster-lizard menace, whose impending return threatens Japan once again, at a time when his robotic foe, Mechagodzilla, is out of commission. Noboru Kaneko, Hiroshi Koizumi, Miho Yoshioka, Katsuya Onizuka, Masami Nagasawa, Chihiro Otsuka(n)

programme.title: Godzilla: Final Wars
programme.desc: Godzilla teams up with Mothra to save the Earth from aliens and an army of evil creatures, including Rodan and Gigan(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Nichols and Stevens investigate the murder of a woman who was found lying in the street, apparently strangled to death, and with a concealed wound on her cheek. When tests reveal traces of alcohol and Valium in her system, Stevens contemplates the plausibility of a medical connection, a suspicion that is soon confirmed when a woman with a recently treated hand injury is found murdered in exactly the same manner. Their investigation then heads to the local community hospital where the victims were last seen alive. Starring Jeff Goldblum and Saffron Burrows.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda struggles to gain control of an investigation into the murder of a businessman and is eventually partnered on the case by Fritz. However, she discovers the FBI has ulterior motives, putting their friendship under further strain. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The team members are forced to reopen a botched murder investigation from three years previously as they attempt to get a pyromaniac serial killer safely behind bars. Meanwhile, Taylor continues to wage his political war on Brenda's rank. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick and Robert Gossett.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Goren and Eames investigate when a legal clerk is found murdered in a judge's house. The judge, Dutch Blakemore, admits he was having an affair with the victim, and it soon emerges he was plagiarising her work. Drama, starring Vincent D'Onofrio, Kathryn Erbe and Jamey Sheridan.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A newly released jailbird attempts to track down the woman he wrote to from prison, and ends up kidnapping her boyfriend, a UN economist. However, when the ex-convict is found dead in a park, Goren and Eames investigate and find that everyone involved in the case has been living a lie.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A woman is stabbed to death after stepping out of her shower, becoming the latest victim of the Dead Rose Slasher. Gibbs is approached by his old friend and barber Frankie Dean, who shares his concern that his son Cameron may be the killer. He explains that a photo-fit released to the media resembles him, and the attacks stopped during a period coinciding with his three-year stint in the navy. Meanwhile, Tony has to take probationary agent Ned Dorneget under his wing.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Marine sergeant Teddy Lemere is killed by a sniper in Afghanistan just after his sniffer dog helps guide a young child out of a minefield. Back in the US, his widow Ruby tells Gibbs and the team that she had recently received a message from her husband saying he might have upset a few people. Abby retrieves a tiny shard of the sniper's bullet from Ted's helmet and finds that it was made in America.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A complaint is filed against Brenda, which threatens her career in the squad, but when Captain Pope offers to help, she is dubious about his intentions. Meanwhile, the detectives are kept busy trying to trace the killer of a Hollywood producer. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The pressure is on for Brenda and her team to solve the murder of a police detective, but as evidence points to one of their own, the Deputy Police Chief struggles to match DNA samples that could prove their case. However, it becomes clear Gabriel and Daniels' relationship to the victim is key to understanding the crime. Drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A woman's murder bears the hallmarks of one committed by jailed serial killer Kevin Reddick, raising fears that he has found an accomplice to carry on his work while he is in prison. The investigation leads back to a series of experiments performed on Reddick to discover the cause of his madness.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the discovery of a woman's body in the Bronx and learn she was reported missing 20 years previously. Suspicion falls on a businessman and his friend, but inquiries hit a dead end - until the team finds a link to two earlier rape cases with similarities to the murder.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A doctor dies on board the USS Borealis during a heavy storm and when the ship is brought into Norfolk Naval Yard, Ducky's investigation reveals a telltale mark on the victim's carotid artery, suggesting he was injected with poison. Initial inquiries focus on a petty officer with a history of drug use who may have wanted the doctor to remain silent about his problems. American drama, starring David McCallum.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team are called in when a Navy reservist returns home to find her husband missing and her living room covered in blood, and make a grim discovery when they find a finger in the bin. Meanwhile, Ziva ruffles a few feathers by insisting on continuing her investigation into the murder of her father, asking for permission to go to Rome on the trail of the chief suspect. Mark Harmon stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Palmer faces a dilemma during a hit-and-run investigation when he spots a stranger standing on a ledge, and places his own life in peril in an attempt to get the man down to safety.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The wife of a man who Danny helped to convict for manslaughter arrives at the TAC offices with a bomb, and takes the team hostage to force Bull to prove her husband's innocence.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Part two of three. Stewie tries to find the man he believes to be his biological father after seeing him on TV, only to discover the stranger is in fact his future self - on holiday in present-day San Francisco. Featuring the voices of Seth MacFarlane, Alex Borstein and Seth Green.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Part three of three. Stewie discovers what his life is like in the future, and decides to go back in time to change events. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane, Alex Borstein and Seth Green.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan begins playing golf with Senator Buckingham in a bid to advance in the CIA, but Roger accidentally sells the politician's daughter to a drug lord, which leaves Stan having to choose between his family and his career.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger bets Klaus that he can make Steve popular at school, but none of his plans seem to work - until the high school's in-crowd realise Steve can be their designated driver. Meanwhile, Stan and Francine play pranks on each other.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Mort and Quagmire both notch up notable achievements, making Peter feel he ought to do something he can be proud of. He decides to set the world record for swallowing coins - but does not take into account the dangers of nickel poisoning.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg becomes convinced she is unattractive to boys, so Lois takes her for the ultimate makeover. Meanwhile, Peter tries to start a band with the guys - and his efforts result in the entire family appearing on Saturday Night Live.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter learns Loretta is having an affair and decides to tell Cleveland - whose response proves disappointingly low-key. Meanwhile, Joe almost dies during a game of charades, prompting Lois to make the family take first-aid classes. Featuring the guest voices of actress Jennifer Tilly and former wrestler Randy Savage.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter tries to prove he is a genius but ends up being classed as mentally challenged - a development he is quick to use to his advantage. Meanwhile, Lois is taken to hospital suffering from burns, leaving Cleveland to look after the children.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie is beaten up by Susie Swanson and begins working out at the gym, determined to get into shape. Meanwhile, Chris begins dating one of the most popular girls in school - whose social standing nosedives as a result.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian is devastated to learn his former girlfriend Jillian is planning to get married - until he meets The Hills star Lauren Conrad and begins to think she is his perfect partner.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan saves Roger's life, but the pair disagree over the chain of events leading to the rescue, resulting in the alien attempting to make a fresh start. Meanwhile, Steve becomes power-hungry when he is given the job of making announcements over the school's PA system.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan tries to prove he is the alpha male at the Smith house when Steve challenges him for family dominance, while Hayley and Jeff seek marriage counselling after their honeymoon period wears off.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. A man and his son on a fishing trip hook what appears to be the body of a petty officer, but the dead man turns out to be a journalist who had been investigating the proliferation of drugs in the Navy. Meanwhile, Ziva returns to her car after a workout at the gym to find her father Eli hiding inside. Guest starring Michael Nouri.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Conclusion. After the deaths of two family members of NCIS employees, the team identifies the killer as a Swedish mercenary and the ballistics report reveals the bullets came from an Iranian arms dealer. McGee traces a wire transfer made to the hitman's ex-wife and son to an account under the name Virtue, and Ziva makes a connection after realising what the Hebrew translation is.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team is called to the scene of a fatal car crash involving marine lance corporal Chad Dunn and student Lyla Cutwright. Duckie notices that the woman's injuries do not match the specifics of the accident and there are no skidmarks found at the scene, leading Gibbs to declare they possibly have a murder and a suicide on their hands. Abby calls in sick for the first time after the case stirs up a traumatic incident from her childhood. Mark Harmon and Pauley Perrette star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs and the team capture computer hacker Ajay Khan, who was recently responsible for hacking into NCIS's supposedly ultra-secure multiple-threat alert centre. They believe he could hold the key to tracking down the most-wanted cyber terrorist in the world, who may be plotting an attack using a bomb containing a strain of the Ebola virus. When Khan refuses to co-operate, Ziva and DiNozzo take him to Guantanamo Bay to be placed with people he had previously betrayed. Guest starring Vik Sahay (Chuck).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the case of a marine who dropped dead while scaling a wall on an assault course, and a fellow soldier reveals that he was heavily involved with an underground fight club, where competitors would battle for cash. Meanwhile, having returned to work after compassionate leave, Vance discovers paperwork and a key in his late wife's effects that lead him to a safety deposit box containing a stash of cash.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs assumes a former alias to infiltrate an infamous anti-government militia. Meanwhile, Bishop and Reeves team up in an off-the-books investigation.(n)

programme.desc: An investigation is launched into the murder of a psychiatrist involved in the trial of a drug designed to treat teenage depression and anxiety. programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates when the daughter of a congresswoman is raped and murdered in her home, and is drawn into a seedy underworld. The evidence prompts her to examine the victim's sexual predilections - and uncovers a secret that could make her the next victim. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda is called on to investigate when a judge is carjacked and murdered. Despite having a long list of witnesses, the one person she's certain can help is the victim's autistic son.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The murder of a gay man stirs political tension in the city, and Chief Pope tasks Brenda with bringing the killer to justice. However, she also has to contend with internal conflicts in the department, as Taylor undermines her authority and a team member actively works against her.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The daughter of a wealthy family's housekeeper is raped and murdered, and the authorities are quick to point the finger of blame at a known sex offender. programme.title: Sherlock Holmes: Terror by Night
programme.desc: The legendary sleuth and his faithful sidekick Dr Watson hunt for the killer of an aristocrat who hired them to keep a priceless diamond out of the hands of thieves. Mystery, starring Basil Rathbone, Nigel Bruce, Alan Mowbray, Dennis Hoey and Mary Forbes.(n)

programme.title: Halls of Montezuma

Second World War adventure, starring Richard Widmark, Jack Palance, Reginald Gardiner, Robert Wagner and Karl Malden.(n)

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: Withdrawn, mute 10-year-old Philip is ignored by his parents and goes off to explore Dartmoor alone, where he meets a retired colonel who shares his knowledge of Devon's wildlife. Under the older man's nurturing tutelage, the boy begins to tame a wild white colt, but fate proffers a series of setbacks just as real progress is being made. Children's drama, starring John Mills, Mark Lester, Sylvia Syms and Bernard Miles.(n)

programme.title: The Addams Family
programme.desc: Creepy couple Morticia and Gomez find their unconventional life threatened by a man claiming to be a long-lost relative. When they welcome him with open arms, they fall prey to a plot that could cost them their ancestral home and the family fortune. Black comedy based on the 1960s TV series, starring Anjelica Huston, Raul Julia, Christopher Lloyd, Christina Ricci, Jimmy Workman and Carel Struycken.(n)

programme.title: Ted

The boy grows up to become a directionless slacker, with the foul-mouthed living toy still his inseparable friend - but his girlfriend thinks it is time for him to grow up. Comedy, starring Mark Wahlberg and Mila Kunis, directed by and featuring the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Kill List
programme.desc: A hitman with money worries is persuaded by his old partner to take on one last job. The duo's mysterious client presents them with a list of three targets, but as they go about their deadly work, they start to realise there is something far more disturbing going on than a simple act of murder. Thriller, with Neil Maskell, Michael Smiley and MyAnna Buring.(n)

programme.title: Requiem for a Dream
programme.desc: Four drug-addicted people go into a downward spiral with devastating effects on their families. A woman takes diet pills in a bid to look slim for her appearance on a TV show, her heroin-addict son and his friend turn to crime to pay for their addiction, and one of the boys' girlfriends faces her own battle with narcotics. Darren Aronofsky's drama, based on the novel by Hubert Selby Jr and starring Jared Leto, Ellen Burstyn, Marlon Wayans and Jennifer Connelly.(n)

programme.title: Siege at Red River

Western, starring Van Johnson, Jeff Morrow and Joanne Dru.(n)

Comedy adventure, starring Kristen Stewart, Corbin Bleu, Max Thieriot and Jennifer Beals.(n)

Comedy, starring Amanda Barrie, Kenneth Williams, Sid James, Kenneth Connor, Jim Dale, Charles Hawtrey and Joan Sims.(n)

Oscar-winning animated comedy, with the voices of Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher and Bill Nighy.(n)

Romantic comedy, starring Julia Roberts and Richard Gere, with Joan Cusack, Hector Elizondo and Rita Wilson.(n)

Martin Scorsese's fact-based drama, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Jonah Hill and Matthew McConaughey.(n)

programme.desc: Hoping to encounter the cowboys he admired as a child, Jamie Oliver heads for Cody in Wyoming, where he samples one of the staples of a cattleman's diet - pitchfork fondue. programme.title: Paul Hollywood: City Bakes
programme.desc: The baker and celebrity chef travels to cities around the world to visit local bakeries and the bakers who work there.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After noticing a decrease in delivery sales, Slice Works asks Charles Stiles to investigate the bicycle delivery service.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: When the owners of Indulge Bistro and Wine Bar in Colorado notice discrepancies in their food costs, they contact Charles Stiles for help.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps struggling owner and chef Mike, of Trends Restaurants in Staten Island which is currently at the mercy of his out-of-control staff.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Owner of Nauna's Bella Casa restaurant asks for help to figure out what his staff are doing when he is not around that is costing him valuable customers.(n)

programme.desc: Comedy highlights, courtesy of the frantic funnyman with the fez, featuring his unique style of magical illusion.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: A curvaceous Ultronian appears, claiming to be George's fiancee - and it falls to space pal Arnie to rescue the superhero from an alien wedding. Meanwhile, there's a crisis at the surgery as Mrs Raven negotiates her contract with an inattentive Piers. Comedy, starring Ardal O'Hanlon.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: Unemployed superhero Polarman seeks refuge in George's living room, while Janet's parents boast about Piers' new car, prompting Thermoman to take drastic action at the health food shop. Comedy, starring Ardal O'Hanlon and Emily Joyce.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Hen-pecked batchelor Timothy comes to the aid of a young runaway, believing her fate rests in his hands. Starring Ronnie Corbett.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy are intrigued by some perfectly respectable men who turn up without their trousers, before they take part in an event sponsored by a village charity.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Walking Stiff Can Make You Famous.
programme.desc: Feeling frustrated by his lack of fame, Foggy invents the sport of bicycle polo, convinced it will not only put his name in lights but prove a lucrative venture. Long-running comedy, starring Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo seizes the opportunity to break into the world of showbusiness when human cannonball Captain Zero cannot perform his act at the local garden fete. Trevor Peacock (The Vicar of Dibley) guest stars, with Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Janey gets involved with a married man and chaos ensues when his wife confronts Susan about the situation. Michael tries to raise money by `selling' his address to a couple looking to secure their child a place at the local school - but it does not go according to plan.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean insists on going back to work having returned from LA, certain she can overcome jet lag, but Lionel just wants to rest. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean tries to organise a new secretary for Lionel, who is troubled by discussions regarding the mini-series. Rocky's honeymoon with Madge ends in hospital after an unfortunate canoeing accident. Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer star.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Empire That Foggy Nearly Built.

programme.desc: Compo decides the way to win the heart of Nora Batty is to become a celebrity, so goes on a televised talent show. Gorden Kaye ('Allo 'Allo!) guest stars, alongside Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: Miami Twice - Part One: The American Dream.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Trotters get a chance to escape Peckham for a holiday in the Florida sun - but it means Del leaving his newborn son behind. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star, with Buster Merryfield, Tessa Peake-Jones, Gwyneth Strong, Denis Lill and Roger Lloyd Pack.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates decide on a wager as the parole board gathers, with Blanco odds-on favourite for release. However, the old lag turns down his freedom and leaves Fletcher in danger of losing a small fortune. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Basil goes to great lengths to prove to Sybil that a guest has smuggled a woman into his room. Instead the hotelier keeps being caught in compromising situations with a young Australian woman, and a visiting psychiatrist finds his increasingly manic behaviour both fascinating and alarming. Classic comedy first broadcast in 1979, starring John Cleese and Prunella Scales.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: A party of German guests comes to stay and Basil resolves to ensure everyone is on their best behaviour. Regrettably, a nasty case of concussion sustained during a fire drill ensures his plans come crashing down. Starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales and Andrew Sachs.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Frustrated bachelors Richie and Eddie get their hands on a video camera following a spot of carnival-time looting, and decide to cash in by staging accidents and selling the tapes to a certain TV show. Comedy, starring Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Dixon Bainbridge announces his intention to demolish the zoo to build a road, so Howard and Vince embark on a perilous journey into the Jungle Room to find the only man who can save them - missing adventurer Tommy Nookah. But first they have to get past a pack of wolves, which proves far more complicated than anticipated.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Famous publisher Hamilton Cork visits the zoo and Howard sees an opportunity to get the novel he has spent his life writing into print - but the esteemed guest is more interested in Vince's story about a character called Charlie. Meanwhile, Bob comes up with a new breeding programme for the pandas.(n)

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Primary school teacher Tom tries to repay a good turn from a late-night caller, but he gradually becomes the victim of his own generosity. As time passes, his new friend Migg becomes an increasingly dominant part of Tom's life, threatening his relationship with aspiring actress girlfriend Gerri. Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith star, with Gemma Arterton (Quantum of Solace) and Conleth Hill (Game of Thrones).(n)

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Jan and Graham's daughter Tamsin is an extremely unwell little girl, so they ask a children's charity to brighten up her ninth birthday. On the day of her party, Sally from WishmakerUK arrives with renowned singer Frankie J Parsons in tow, but events soon take a sinister turn. Starring Steve Pemberton, Sophie Thompson, Tamsin Greig and David Bedella.(n)

programme.title: Nathan Barley
programme.desc: Ultra-hip columnist Dan Ashcroft is plagued by a pesky photographer, while Nathan continues his cringe-inducing attempts to seduce Claire by plying the unfortunate woman with alcohol and unsolicited groping - in the guise of a massage. Comedy, starring Julian Barratt, Nick Burns and Claire Keelan.(n)

programme.title: The Armando Iannucci Shows
programme.desc: A woman wakes up screaming when she remembers she designs bacon packaging for a living, and firemen take up stripping - while putting out fires at the same time. Plus, Hale and Pace get jobs in a shoe shop and a flight simulator crashes. Comedy sketch show poking fun at people's feelings and fears.(n)

programme.title: jam
programme.desc: Offbeat comedy featuring bizarre and surreal sketches. Amelia Bullmore, David Cann, Julia Davis, Kevin Eldon and Mark Heap star.(n)

programme.title: French and Saunders
programme.desc: The comedy duo pay tongue-in-cheek tribute to Fleetwood Mac, discuss Jerry Hall and star in a parody of In Bed with Madonna.(n)

programme.desc: Martin's sense of authority begins to wane when the arrival of new neighbour Paul threatens the equilibrium in his community.
