programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: Joyce and Alan have financial concerns and consider downsizing, but - hoping to keep it quiet for the time being - they don't count on their friends being there when the estate agent arrives to look round. Maureen has finally decided to move elderly mum Joan into a residential home, while the men convince John that his sister-in-law's over-friendly behaviour is actually a form of sexual harassment and, having put up with it for 40 years, he decides it's time he finally spoke up. Comedy, starring Alison Steadman, Philip Jackson, Russ Abbot and June Whitfield.(n)

programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: They say age is but a number, and every year Joyce, Alan and the gang like to remind themselves of that by attending a 1960s-themed weekend at a seaside resort, and partying their evenings away. However, this time, Alan's in their bad books, having messed up the booking, leaving them with only two rooms between the six of them. Meanwhile, John is determined to prove he's not old and starts by taking on the climbing wall, and Carol bumps into an old friend, which could spell trouble for her relationship with Trevor. Comedy, starring Alison Steadman, Philip Jackson, Russ Abbot and Paula Wilcox.(n)

programme.title: Porridge: Inside Out
programme.desc: A look at the making of the prison sitcom, originally shown to coincide with its 40th anniversary. Writers Dick Clement and Ian La Frenais guide cameras around the pivotal places they visited during the creation and development of the series, including the pub where they first met, the prisons they researched, and the filming locations they used. Plus, contributions by the show's admirers, surviving members of the cast and members of the production crew.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barraclough uncover the stash in his cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The rundown state of the flats in Nelson Mandela House prompts Rodney to join the residents' committee, and he soon finds himself hobnobbing with council officials - a situation Del quickly exploits. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tires of his role as junior partner in Trotters Independent Traders and decides to set up a rival business with best mate and would-be wide boy Mickey Pearce, hoping to give wheeler-dealer Del a run for his money. Nicholas Lyndhurst, David Jason and Patrick Murray star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del's latest foolproof scheme to make a million involves a spot of salmon-poaching, but the wheeler-dealer finds the bracing country air is not all it's cracked up to be. David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Del falls for a glamorous antiques dealer who comes to view an old cabinet described as a `Queen Anne' original - but the feeling is not necessarily mutual. Comedy, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.sub-title: May the Force Be with You.
programme.desc: Rodney unwittingly causes uproar in the Trotter household by bringing home a stranger claiming to be an old friend of Del's. Starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst, with a guest appearance by Jim Broadbent.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney tries to help a drunken woman on the street, but his good deed backfires. Fearful of a life behind bars, he promptly goes into hiding - unaware devious brother Del has set him up as a joke. Comedy, starring Nicholas Lyndhurst and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The Trotters embark on a decorating venture for Denzil. When they find a canary lying dead in its cage, they race to replace it before the deal is ruined. Comedy, with David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: The very first episode of the award-winning comedy kicks off with Edina and Patsy hitting the bottle as they struggle to cope with career and family pressures. Starring Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina is horrified when Bubble tells her she is about to be visited by Penny Caspar-Morse, an ultra-thin model she knew in the 1960s who used to torment her about her weight. She decides to lose some weight, but abandons her exercise programme and lets Patsy schedule her an appointment to have liposuction. Comedy, guest starring Alexandra Bastedo, with Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley.(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Edina and Patsy set off for a break in the heart of rural Provence, only to find their chateau is nowhere near as luxurious as they were expecting. Comedy, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Eddie and Richie agree to mind their landlord's shop - and end up irritating the locals so much they find themselves facing a gang of looters. John Wells guest stars, alongside Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson as the puerile flatmates.(n)

programme.title: Filthy, Rich and Catflap
programme.desc: Richie plans to profit from his father's death by selling advertising rights for the funeral. When the old man recovers however, the comic takes matters into his own hands.(n)

programme.title: Choccywoccydoodah
programme.desc: The crew creates a skull-inspired cake for Rottingdean's annual smugglers' night.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: First-ever episode of the series in which enthusiastic home cooks take part in a contest to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur baker. The first stop on their nationwide tour is the Cotswolds, where judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood challenge them to make their signature cakes and tackle a recipe for Victoria sponge. The week's final task sees them producing a tricky chocolate celebration cake. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Michel Roux Jr oversee proceedings as six chefs battle it out in the quarter-final, preparing a dish of their own invention from a range of ingredients including oysters, whelks, mangos, white chocolate and dates. Only four contestants will make it to the next challenge, in which they have to cook two courses for food critics William Sitwell, Tracey MacLeod and Jay Rayner - with two going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate British beef, using it in a suet pudding and making oxtail soup. They visit a farmer who is focusing on the future with his wagyu cattle, discover the history of the much-maligned dish tripe and learn how to roast a whole ox.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kuruvita's Coastal Kitchen
programme.desc: Peter discovers the secrets of bush tucker and creates dishes inspired by these ingredients.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kuruvita's Coastal Kitchen
programme.desc: Peter meets with a community of passionate local producers, showcasing some of the finest and freshest produce in Australia's Sunshine Coast.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates the arrival of summer with a fair. He prepares elderflower champagne and the Bristol families spit-roast pigs, lamb and goat. The final crops he still has to harvest are peas, gooseberries and wet garlic, at which time he will have experienced all that his land has to offer during his favourite season of the year.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace return to put more keen cooks to the test. The first five hopefuls begin by serving up their Calling Card, a dish that showcases their talent - and this year, it carries a prize as the judges' two favourites will sail through to the third round. Then it's new challenge the Reinvention Test, in which they create a new plate of food based on their main ingredient from the first round, before one goes home and the rest cook dinner for a trio of former MasterChef champions.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Five more cooks compete for a place in the quarter-final, preparing a dish that represents who they are, before the three least successful hopefuls rustle up a different plate of food using the same main ingredient in the Reinvention Test. One cook is shown the door, and then the remaining four face the daunting task of preparing dinner for reigning MasterChef champion Ping Coombes and former finalists Jack Lucas and Luke Owen. But which pair will John Torode and Gregg Wallace put through?.(n)

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's Vietnam
programme.desc: The chef boards a boat and sails through Ha Long Bay before sampling local seafood.(n)

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's Vietnam
programme.desc: The chef prepares a young jackfruit salad, cooks fish, and joins in a traditional bamboo dance in Mai Chau.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals

programme.title: The Breakfast Club
programme.desc: Teen-angst comedy drama. Five total strangers - an athlete, a spoiled rich kid, a brainy nerd, an introverted loner and a rebellious punk - are brought together on a day-long detention where they break the rules, bare their souls and find they have more in common than just attending the same high school. One of the plethora of 80s teen films, John Hughes's bittersweet 'brat pack' comedy has many perceptive moments(n)

programme.title: Rocket Science
programme.desc: Coming-of-age saga examining the sometimes torturous, sometimes rewarding high-school experience. The extremely talented Reece Daniel Thompson portrays a stuttering teen who joins the school's debate squad and falls in love with a female teammate (Anna Kendrick). Written and directed by Jeffrey Blitz, who chronicled spelling-bee competitions in the documentary "Spellbound." Blitz also overcame his own teenage stuttering problem. The soundtrack features music by the Violent Femmes(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: One woman's rocky road to the altar gets played for laughs in this comedy, adapted from the one-woman off-Broadway show written by and starring Nia Vardalos. Toula (Vardalos) is a Greek-American woman who is in her early thirties and single, with no immediate prospects of changing that status any time soon. This bothers Toula a bit, but not half as much as it distresses her mother (Lainie Kazan) and father (Michael Constantine), who want to send her to Greece in hopes of finding a husband in the old country. Toula isn't interested in leaving the country to find a man, but since she works in the family business -- a Greek restaurant in Chicago called Dancing Zorba's -- she has to hear about it whether she likes it or not. One day, after seeing a handsome stranger in the restaurant and not having the courage to talk to him, Toula decides she needs a bit of self-improvement. Despite her dad's misgivings, Toula signs up for a night-school class studying computers, trades in her glasses for contact lenses, gets a different job at a travel agency, and spruces herself up with a new look and a new attitude. To her very pleasant surprise, she once again encounters the handsome stranger, who soon asks her out on a date. Schoolteacher Ian Miller (John Corbett) is seemingly perfect -- he's tall, handsome, smart, good-natured, and soon in love with Toula -- except for two little things: he's not Greek, and he's a vegetarian, both of which horrify Toula's family. When Ian pops the question (and Toula says yes), the bride-to-be has to negotiate a reasonably peaceful meeting between Ian's upper-class parents and her own working-class extended family. There's also the matter of the wedding, which Toula's mother is planning around the notion that quantity IS quality. My Big Fat Greek Wedding also features Ian Gomez (Vardalos' real-life husband), Louis Mandylor, Andrea Martin, and Joey Fatone (from the pop group *NSYNC). Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson helped produce the film through the auspices of their production company, Playtone(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: Romantic comedy about a failed songwriter-turned-singer who makes a living on the wedding circuit in the 1980s. After being jilted at his own wedding, he becomes disillusioned about romance, but his spirits are soon lifted by a waitress who works at the same events(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law) in this sidesplitting action comedy. After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Wall Street Banker Jack Campbell has it all: more cash than he can shake a stick at, oodles of power and, above all, his freedom. But on Christmas Eve he challenges an armed robber, then on Christmas Day he wakes up to the life he would have had if he'd stayed with his college girlfriend: two noisy kids, a dead-end job selling tyres, and a people carrier instead of his Ferrari. At first he's horrified(n)

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Action-packed sequel to the sci-fi comedy about a top secret government task force set up to deal with unruly extraterrestrials. An MIB agent turns to his former mentor to help him save the world from a rampaging, shape-shifting alien who has taken on the outward appearance of a sexy lingerie model(n)

programme.title: Sixteen Candles
programme.desc: On the eve of her sister's wedding, suburban teenager Samantha suffers silently as her family forgets her birthday. Even worse, some total dork keeps propositioning her with sophomoric innuendo when she really craves romantic attention from high-school hunk Jake. This bittersweet teen comedy traces the hopes and disappointments not only of Samantha, but also a host of incidental but memorable characters..(n)

programme.desc: A local black community is unhappy that their community is effectively being run by whites. As the heat rises on a hot summer's day in Brooklyn, so the racial tension, which has so far lay dormant under the surface, begins to rise(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Sharkboy and Lavagirl
programme.desc: Writer and director Robert Rodriguez returns to the family-friendly adventure of his Spy Kids movies with this three-dimensional action opus. Max (Cayden Boyd) is a ten-year-old boy who doesn't get along with his peers and is constantly bullied at school. But Max has an active imagination, and he has a pair of very special imaginary playmates -- Shark Boy (Taylor Lautner), a human-shark half-breed cared for by a pack of great whites, and Lava Girl (Taylor Dooley), a girl with superpowers who can conjure heat and fire at will. Max may be a creative boy, but what he doesn't know is that Shark Boy and Lava Girl really do exist, and he is recruited to help them as they do battle against Mr. Electricity, a super-villain determined to deprive children of their sleep. Shot and originally released in the 3-D format, The Adventures of Shark Boy and Lava Girl also stars David Arquette and Kristin Davis as Max's parents, and George Lopez as a schoolteacher; writer and director Rodriguez wrote the film's story in collaboration with his then seven-year-old son, Racer Rodriguez(n)

programme.title: Rosewood
programme.desc: A true story. It is January 1, 1923 in Rosewood, but in this largely black town built on family, faith and hard work, hopes for the New Year abruptly end. In a few harrowing nights, a white mob razes Rosewood into oblivion. As the rampage gains cataclysmic force, a heroic World War I veteran and a shopkeeper join forces. Dozens of terrified women and children have fled into nearby swamps. Somehow they must be led to safety(n)

programme.title: Blast From the Past
programme.desc: At the height of the Cuban missile crisis in the 1960s, Calvin Webber takes his pregnant wife Helen underground into a cavernous air raid shelter. Misinterpreting a plane crash as war, they spend the next 35 years entombed there. Their son, Adam, is brought up learning foreign languages, dancing, boxing and playing in the astro-turfed 'back yard'. When he is sent to get supplies from the world above, he meets Eve and, in this romantic comedy, discovers the good and bad sides of 1990s America(n)

Carlito is determined to go straight, but he agrees to take part in a lucrative shady business deal at his attorney's instigation - figuring to discharge the debt of gratitude he owes. Despite his intentions, he finds himself relentlessly drawn back into the world he sought to escape(n)

They decamp to New York, sealing Hell shut, but, without a regular supply of souls, Satan could literally evaporate into thin air. His only hope lies in his nerdy youngest son Nicky, but even with the help of Valerie and a talking dog, he's going to have problems persuading his bigger brothers to return to Hell and save Dad in Steven Brill's laugh-out-loud comedy(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: (2008) Danny Boyle's eight Oscar- and seven BAFTA-winning blockbuster opens as Jamal Malik (Dev Patel), a chaiwalah at a call centre, is on the verge of winning 20 million rupees on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? . But the host of the show, Prem Kumar (Anil Kapoor) is convinced he's cheating and hands him over to the police to beat the truth out of him. Jamal reveals that the right answer to each question has come from a significant part of his life, from when he and his brother Salim were orphaned after their mother was killed in religious violence. As he continues his story, Jamal reveals how he knows each answer; how he fell in love with Latika, an orphaned girl from whom he was later separated; and how his brother Salim took the path of violence as a gangster's gunman. But as Jamal is returned to the studio for the last question, Salim finally repays his brother's trust. As well as the outstanding Patel, Jamal is played in different stages of his life by Tanay Hemant Gharu and Ayush Mahesh Khedekar; Salim is played by Madhur Mittal, Ashutosh Lobo Gajiwala and Azharuddin Mohammed Ismail; Latika is played by Frieda Pinto, Tanvi Ganesh Lonkar and Rubina Ali, all of whom turn in stunning performances. English/ Hindi with English subtitles(n)

An 18th-century notary goes on a sea voyage; a musician becomes an apprentice to a famous composer in 1930s Belgium; a journalist uncovers corruption at a nuclear power plant in '70s California; a contemporary publisher seeks refuge from gangsters at a nursing home; a clone escapes her job at a fast-food establishment in futuristic Korea; a tribesman struggles to survive in a post-apocalyptic wasteland(n)

programme.title: Joe Somebody
programme.desc: Tim Allen, Patrick Warburton and Julie Bowen star in John Pasquin's comedy-drama about a man whose life is changed by a bullying incident. Mild-mannered Joe Scheffer is taking his pre-teen daughter Natalie to a corporate event at his big pharma workplace when an argument over a parking space results in Joe being set upon by a colleague Mark McKinney. The incident destroys Joe's confidence and he sinks into a depression that keeps him away from work. But his life is set to change when the company's 'wellness co-ordinator', Meg Harper, pays him a visit. There's immediate mutual attraction, but something she says to Joe also inadvertently sparks a desire for revenge in him. It's not long before he's training with Chuck Scarett, a former martial arts film star; and - back at work - his new, assertive persona is winning him legions of friends. But not everyone is impressed - Natalie and Meg preferred him as he was..(n)

Ali Carter, the only survivor of the original cull is recruited by A J Cook to stop his second campaign. Cook foresaw a freeway pileup but those she saved by her actions are now marked. Can the pair, aided by cop Michael Landes and the knowledge of the sage Tony Todd save those marked for death?(n)

programme.title: Final Destination 3
programme.desc: (2006) James Wong, who directed the first film in the horror franchise, returned for this sequel. Mary Elizabeth Winstead plays Wendy Christensen, who has a premonition that the roller coaster she and her school friends are on is going to crash. Sure enough, after they get off, there is a spectacular, satisfyingly gory crash. But once again, Death will not be cheated of his due and, as the survivors succumb one by one in suitably ingenious ways (the tanning salon incident is particularly worth catching), Wendy and her friend Kevin Fischer (Ryan Merriman) try to work out who is next and how they'll escape(n)

British comedy, with John Mills, Richard Attenborough, Michael Hordern, Lionel Jeffries and Bryan Forbes.(n)

programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary investigate the mysterious death of a blind professor caught up in a bitter battle to save his beloved allotment from an unscrupulous land developer. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.(n)

programme.desc: First-ever episode of the popular crime drama, starring John Thaw as author Colin Dexter's Oxford detective who treats his cases as intellectual challenges. Co-starring Gemma Jones, Patrick Troughton, James Grout and Peter Woodthorpe.(n)

Soon deep in a full-blown murder investigation, Endeavour is sidelined, discredited and at a dead end - so he risks all to begin his own quest for justice. Roger Allam and Charlie Creed-Miles co-star in the mystery.(n)

When an alchemic image is discovered by the body, denoting the first of four stages of a process called `The Magnum Opus', the detectives realise that there are three more murders to follow. Before any more crimes are committed, the team must uncover the guilty secret that the victims share in order to learn the identity of the killer and the potential victims.(n)

Meanwhile, Janet also has problems to deal with at home, as Elise moves in with her dad and his new girlfriend. But at least it inspires the detective to look at her own love life, as she confides in Rachel that she's started using dating sites. Crime drama, starring Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp and Danny Miller.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey

Meanwhile, Janet gets cold feet when she goes on her first date, terrified at the idea of having to impress a stranger. The crimebusters are united in the search for the killer of Rich Hutchings, who is found murdered in the flat he shares with his husband Adam. Barry, their outspoken and violent homophobic neighbour, is the prime suspect. However, as Adam's friend Tim struggles to recall the events of their night out, it seems Barry may be in the clear. With Jim's suspicions confirmed, a police report then reveals Clare's boyfriend Ryan and his friends had been partying near the scene hours before the blaze started, but where are they now, and where is Deena's best friend Sally? programme.desc: Michael Gambon stars as Winston Churchill in this feature-length drama based on Jonathan Smith's novel. In 1953, a nurse (Romola Garai) is summoned to a secret location where she learns she is needed to treat the elderly prime minister, who has suffered a stroke and is not expected to survive. She bears witness as Churchill's family gather by his bedside preparing for the worst, and sees the long-buried tensions between them rising to the surface. programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part one of two. When the body of student Josh Tate is found dumped in a ravine, the investigation into his stabbing uncovers a very different man to the quiet character described by his flatmate Spencer. It emerges that Josh was infatuated with Spencer's girlfriend and had been manufacturing Ecstasy for club owner Liam Fallon. Meanwhile, DI Morton's ex-lover Martin Hexton has arrived, claiming to be working on a local case. When Fallon comes under suspicion as Josh's murderer the detectives break into his flat and find him badly beaten - and to complicate matters, it looks as if Hexton is responsible.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks

The team traces the former undercover police officer to Gerald and Elaine Foster's house, but it's too late - Hexton has kidnapped lap-dancer Melanie. When his victim collapses, however, he takes her to hospital, where ex-lover Helen corners him and has him arrested. What will he reveal about Josh and Melanie, and the attack on club owner Liam? The plot thickened when Cosa fled to his native Turkey and the body of his wife was was found stuffed in a bag in a New York steel factory where he had worked. A year later, in an apparent suicide, Cosa fell to his death from a tall building,.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Next Door
programme.desc: The 1991 fatal shooting of cashier Tammy Petrin at a burger house in Woonsocket, Rhode Island. After lead suspects were discounted, a prostitute and prison letters provided detectives with vital clues citing her imprisoned husband's involvement in the case. It transpired Ronald Harnois hired two of his ex-fellow inmates to kill Tammy so she couldn't testify against him in an upcoming trial.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jerry Lockett hosts the second dinner party in Cardiff, and following a flood at his home, hopes to impress his guests by serving the meal at the grand venue of his cousin's mansion.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Costume designer Sam Clarke prepares a Mexican menu for the fourth dinner party in Cardiff. Everything does not go to plan, however, when two guests begin fighting at the table, and his `fun' game leaves everyone in tears.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Childminder Andrea Grainger hosts the last dinner party as the competition in Cardiff draws to a close. programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi takes Savita and Vinod Patel from Hertfordshire house-hunting in and around the picturesque town of Denia on Spain's Costa Blanca. The couple must choose between the convenience of the town and the amazing views on offer just a little farther afield.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Coberley, Gloucestershire: Mysteries of the Mosaic.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to a Cotswolds field, where they suspect the great and the good of Roman Britain once built their homes. However, an extensive dig reveals that the site was once a hub of worship for Bacchus, the pagan god of wine and entertainment, and its destruction was a result of iconoclasm practised by early Roman Christians.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Padstow, Cornwall: From Constantinople to Cornwall.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Padstow, Cornwall, to investigate why 1,500-year-old pottery and metalwork originating in North Africa and Turkey have been discovered by locals. The geophysics results suggest the field in which they were found may have contained an Iron Age village, while the archaeologists suspect the nearby sandy cove may have been a port dealing with traders from throughout the Mediterranean.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw and master mechanic Fuzz Townshend head to Brighton to secretly restore a 1984 Audi UR Quattro, which has been under a tarpaulin on a drive for 10 years. Owner Barry has dreamed of working on the vehicle, but health issues have left him sapped of energy and unable to fulfil his wish.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A woman who suffers from nocturnal epileptic fits brings in Pearl, a Staffordshire Bull Terrier that can sense when her episodes are about to happen. However, the dog has problems with its knees and struggles to walk, so the pressure is on for Professor Noel Fitzpatrick to restore it back to full health. Plus, an Irish Setter has a cancerous tumour in its front leg, and a cat needs its jaw wiring back together after being hit by a car.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A poodle called Diamond has been referred for a total hip replacement, and another, with the same owner, needs a new knee. Noel Fitzpatrick operates on both dogs on the same day, and doesn't finish until 3am. Hopity, a 12-week-old Balinese kitten, has a deformity on one of her back legs, which she could end up losing, while the operation itself is a huge risk. Hazell has brought in Dandi, a five month-old German shepherd who is lame in both front legs.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud watches over developments as Jeremy and Louise Brown try to convert a Grade II-listed 16th-century farmhouse in Gloucestershire that has barely been touched for more than 400 years into a luxurious modern home. They hope to reconcile the old with the new and retain the building's original historic features, including its doorways, beams and hay loft.(n)

programme.title: The Team
programme.desc: Loukauskis manages to escape the police, who immediately set up an international warrant for his arrest as they have found evidence that he raped Iris Gabler's daughter when she was 14. In a secret Skype conversation, Jean-Louis attempts to get a confession out of Loukauskis, but the billionaire has his own reasons for agreeing to take part in an interview. As Jackie and Harald try to figure out Loukauskis' whereabouts, Alicia faces her own private nightmare. Thriller, starring Lars Mikkelsen, Jasmin Gerat and Veerle Baetens. In English, German, Flemish, French and Danish.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Junior doctor Simon is concerned 40-year-old doorman Alfred, who was stabbed multiple times outside the social club where he works, may have internal injuries. Eighteen-year-old student George is brought into resus with blood coming from his ear and behaving erratically, following a fight at a party, and is sent for an urgent scan when consultant Phil becomes worried he may have a life-threatening bleed on his brain.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The medics treat 60-year-old diabetic Tony, who has an infected leg wound and must be assessed to ensure it doesn't spread, and three-year-old Billy, who has swollen eyes after accidentally squirting detergent in them. Also treated is 80-year-old Ida, who has pain in her knee, and doctors are concerned when an x-ray reveals a shadow on her bone, which requires further tests to rule out cancer.(n)

programme.title: A Very British Brothel
programme.desc: A return visit to a Sheffield massage parlour, run by a mother and daughter, which sees business booming for owner Kath, who harbours plans to open a second establishment. However, new premises in the city are thin on the ground, and Kath has daily problems to contend with, such as damp in the gentleman's lounge and a customer with a custard fetish.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Vic Reeves and Aisling Bea join host Jimmy Carr and team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson for more comic innuendos, unpredictable conundrums and unforgivable puns in the comedy quiz. David O'Doherty is with Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Junior doctor Simon is concerned 40-year-old doorman Alfred, who was stabbed multiple times outside the social club where he works, may have internal injuries. Eighteen-year-old student George is brought into resus with blood coming from his ear and behaving erratically, following a fight at a party, and is sent for an urgent scan when consultant Phil becomes worried he may have a life-threatening bleed on his brain.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty investigates the nation's cod consumption and looks at how the fish is imported from Iceland in large quantities. Kate Quilton finds out why most British supermarkets stock only one variety of banana and heads to Malaysia to learn about a disease threatening the future of the popular fruit. Matt Tebbutt examines popcorn production, revealing why eating bucketloads of it might not satisfy a person's appetite.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Driving instructor Ray Dodd hosts the first dinner party in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, but finds his guests a difficult crowd to please. Recruitment executive Michelle Watson turns her nose up at the salmon starter, while choir director Joseph Benneh sends his steak back to the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Recruitment executive Michelle Watson welcomes the diners to her home for the second dinner party of the week in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, but the previous night's host Ray Dodd is hungry for revenge following stinging criticism of his efforts. Michelle's cooking also fails to impress Joseph Benneh, so her hopes of scooping the week's prize rest with her choice of entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stuart Henson hosts a safari-themed dinner party on the third night in Milton Keynes. He hopes his exotic menu of zebra steak and `elephant dung surprise' will please his guests, but after the insults of the previous night he faces a difficult challenge to persuade his fellow diners to get along.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Choir director Joseph Benneh hosts the fourth dinner party in Milton Keynes, hoping the flavours from his homeland Ghana and a vocal masterclass will prove a winning combination. The guests' expectations are high, so he is under pressure to hit the spot with a menu that includes chicken liver pate, and groundnut soup with coconut rice.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Country enthusiast Susan Rogers hosts the final dinner party in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, hoping her French cuisine will win her extra points. She also demonstrates her skills with an accordion and gives her guests an origami masterclass, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search Hampshire, Wiltshire and Surrey as they try to find homes for this week's couples. Retirees Sheila and Jason are living out of boxes after selling their home in Morecambe and now they just want to be nearer their families, while Sue and Alan have moved back from Australia, only to find their generous budget of £450,000 does not stretch to the spacious apartment they had Down Under - and getting them to downsize could prove an uphill struggle for Phil.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: A former businesswoman seeks a home in north Wales but is unsure if she wants to live by the coast or in the countryside, so Kerr Drummond and Sara Damergi help solve her dilemma.(n)

programme.title: Rivers with Jeremy Paxman
programme.desc: The presenter travels along the Thames from its source in Gloucestershire to the Kent and Essex marshes, and delves into its history as a working river going back to the time of the Domesday Book. He meets people who maintain the river's locks and bridges, and work to manage flooding and deal with sewage. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Another selection of B&B owners take it in turns as hosts to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money. The contest begins at Knockaloe Beg Farm on the Isle of Man, where owners Fiona and John Anderson hope their guests will embrace their green ethos. They kick things off with an afternoon of laser mayhem, and continue the fun the next day by following breakfast with hands-on animal antics.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests head to The Arches on the Isle of Man for their second stay, where owner Phil Routledge hopes to wow them with scenic views and scuba diving at the B&B's own pool. However, some of the owners are dismayed by modern gadgets with a lack of instructions, and even find cobwebs in their rooms.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants arrive at the Trafford in Blackpool, owned by Robbie and John Welling, who are proud of their traditional `bucket and spade' B&B. The guests are pleasantly surprised, even if previous host Phil is intent on finding dust as a bit of tit-for-tat retaliation, and the afternoon is spent learning the art of making sticks of rock.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Host Julie welcomes the contestants to Sheepy Lodge, Warwickshire, where they are shocked by their surroundings, and disappointed by a variety of things in the rooms. The host puts on some old-fashioned parlour games, before a fierce hide-and-seek contest erupts. At breakfast, Julie frets when she must prepare poached eggs, and is left emotional after the feedback.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rival B&B owners meet to settle some scores and discover what they have been paid. Knockaloe Beg Farm owners Fiona and John Anderson tackle criticisms of a missing host at breakfast, and Phil Routledge from The Arches on the Isle of Man takes on Robbie and John Welling from The Trafford in Blackpool about their `forensic investigation'. After some heated discussion, the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Marketing manager Andrea Nichols hosts the first night in a week of dinner parties that span Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire. She welcomes dance instructor Nicola O'Donnell, saleswoman Penny Peklivanas, music producer Tim Lawson and events entertainer Andy Harvey into her garden that has been decked out with straw and stuffed chickens in a bid to win the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kitchenware saleswoman Penny Peklivanas hosts the second party in a competition that spans Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire. She is confident her grand house will impress her rivals and win her the £1,000 cash prize, but her croissant-based main course is not to everyone's taste.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: IT analyst and music producer Tim Lawson hosts the third dinner party of the week in the competition taking place across Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire, hoping to impress his diners with ingredients brought back from Morocco. He also offers an urban music education in a bid to claim the £1,000-prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dance instructor Nicola O'Donnell hosts the fourth dinner party of the competition spanning Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire. The guests expect very little from the night, but Nicola hopes to impress Jamaican-born contestant Tim Lawson with her Caribbean-inspired evening.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Andy Harvey hosts the final night of the competition which has visited Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire and Hertfordshire. He decides to pull out all the stops at his Stevenage home, hoping to impress with extravagant food and outrageous entertainment - including a luminous underwater disco. At the end of the evening, his dinner guests reveal their scores before the winner of the £1,000 prize is revealed.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: A visit to a town in South Carolina where it's raining popcorn-like snow - actually little balls of ice called graupel that appear harmless but could trigger avalanches. Storm chaser Geoff Mackley films a dangerous concoction of volcanic ash, rocks, debris and water called lahar, and a man in Newfoundland records footage of a strange, rolling bank of fog that looks like a tsunami. In Canberra, there's a giant tornado born not from a thundercloud but from a colossal firestorm, while in the Peak District, strong winds defy gravity - blowing a waterfall upwards.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Wildest Weather
programme.desc: Footage of unusual weather conditions recorded in Britain during 2016, and exploring the factors that led to these incidents. The programme features footage recorded by people caught in the middle of floods, super-storms, tornadoes and lightning strikes, as well as a look at how a record level El Nino effect altered Britain's weather.(n)

programme.title: Lee Mack: Hit the Road Mack
programme.desc: Filmed at London's Hammersmith Apollo, this documentary showcases the multi award-winning star at the top of his game, in a performance that soon has his audience roaring with laughter. Lee's trademark humour of well-created gags and sharp one-liners are plentiful as he muses on the perils of everyday life, while sharing plenty of fun, quips and banter with the audience.(n)

programme.title: Breakout
programme.desc: The Escapist. Can the state-of-the-art facility at Alton, Illinois, hold a modern-day Houdini who has made repeated escape attempts? Quawntay Adams is regarded as a high risk category inmate, and his single cell is a prefabricated quarter-inch thick steel box constantly monitored by security cameras, and with prison guards checking on him every 30 minutes. But Adams has nothing to lose. Despite the security, he manages to smuggle in a hacksaw blade and cuts a hole in the ceiling of his cell. He escapes through a ventilation shaft, where a female accomplice waits for him. But as he is hunted down by US Marshals, Adams' ingenuity eventually fails him(n)

programme.desc: Cake Off!. The pesky pranksters this time are Pranking Pandemonium and Shining Stars. They team up with prosthetics and make-up wizard Shaune Harrison and prop maker and SFX specialist Simon Tayler to stage pranks on an unsuspecting public. The teams mock up a fancy art gallery and rig the hidden cameras and special effects required to bring the pranksters' ideas to life. But which team will impress our prank-loving panel of ranksters to win the chance to stage a prank on a target of their choice? Louis and Albie's $3,000,000 art installation Sneezing Statue takes on Thomas and Abbie's alarming Picture Breakout! For the winning team, our effectors have planned a prank at a local cake decorating competition called Cake Off, featuring an out-of-control cake icing machine, an eccentric cake chef and an exploding cake which causes chaos and plenty of mess(n)

programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series focuses on Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson attempts to build a car that is even smaller than the Peel P50 and then tests it out on the streets of London before pitching his concept in the Dragons' Den. James May puts the Bentley Continental GT Speed through its paces by taking it on a rally stage, while Richard Hammond drives the new Pagani Huayra hypercar before handing it over to the Stig. Actor Damian Lewis goes for a spin in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Short Circuit
programme.desc: A military robot is struck by lightning and develops a mind of its own. The machine embarks on a series of comic misadventures, but the company that made him want him back. He realises his only hope is to convince the scientist who invented him that he really is alive. Sci-fi comedy adventure, starring Steve Guttenberg, Ally Sheedy and Fisher Stevens.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: Empire of the Desert Ants.
programme.desc: Documentary filmed in Arizona, following a honey ant queen's rise to dominance and the methods it uses to extend its influence and keep its subjects under control, including cannibalism, genocide, the ruthless elimination of rivals and the sacrifice of thousands. Narrated by Andy Serkis.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Weirdest Events
programme.desc: Chris Packham concludes his study of peculiar natural events with the help of eyewitness footage, first-hand accounts and scientific explanations. Featuring the story of a virgin snake that gave birth in the UK, a sea serpent that washed up on the Californian coast and 12 goats that were found standing perfectly still in a tree in Morocco.(n)

programme.title: Talk to the Animals
programme.desc: Lucy Cooke concludes her global exploration of the world of animal communication, focusing on how they talk to friends and enemies and even what they say to their neighbours. The zoologist discovers the many uses of the spotted hyena's call, tricks some vervet monkeys into warning each other of danger, meets the only bat in the world that can eavesdrop on frogs and finds out that dolphins not only greet one another, they also have unique signatures or names.(n)

programme.title: After Earth
programme.desc: A spaceship crash leaves a renowned war hero and his 13-year-old son stranded on Earth, which was abandoned by the human race centuries ago. Since mankind's departure, the planet has become home to all manner of dangerous life-forms, and the boy must make a desperate journey across hostile terrain to secure a rescue for his injured father. Sci-fi adventure, starring Will and Jaden Smith, with Sophie Okonedo.(n)

programme.desc: Paranormal activity in Rainbow Valley, Arizona. During the investigation, the forces that inhabit the Stardust Ranch prove they don't welcome the attention of ghost hunters Zak Bagans, Nick Groff and Aaron Goodwin.(n)

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers in Bedfordshire target motorists breaking the law, including those using mobile phones, not wearing seatbelts, or having illegal number plates. Narrated by Jamie Theakston.(n)

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers in Bedfordshire are trained in the use of an electroshock weapon, and the experience is put into practice when they use the device to disarm a gang member in the middle of the night and take him into custody. Narrated by Jamie Theakston.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Aled Jones helps a couple from Enfield, north London, find a detached property in Essex on a budget of £400,000. Their wish list is long, including rural views, a big kitchen, and a garden with enough space to create a veggie plot.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple from Maidenhead, with a £500,000 budget, who want to relocate from Berkshire to Somerset and find a three-bedroom detached house with at least two acres of land for growing vegetables and keep animals.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a five-bedroom property in Plymouth, a Victorian cottage in Croydon, south London, and a former coach house in Cardiff. They then talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings, and how much they paid for them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts visit a cafe with a first-floor flat in Pembrokeshire, a three bedroom mid-terraced house in London and a two bedroom mid-terrace in Stoke-on-Trent, then follow the sales at auction and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton travels to Derbyshire to find an idyllic retreat for a couple from Herefordshire with a budget of £375,000. However, the pair struggle to agree on whether they want rural isolation or a property in a village.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Spalding.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles is in Spalding, Lincolnshire, to meet Dakota Read and her family. The eight-year-old was born with quadriplegic cerebral palsy and her home needs to be made more wheelchair-friendly. Enter the DIY SOS builders, who set to work on designer Gabrielle Blackman's vision, although with just nine days to complete the task, they'll need help. Luckily, the local tradespeople are also out in force, giving their time and their skills for free.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Sunderland.
programme.desc: Ever since suffering a brain infection four years ago, Sunderland woman June Findlay has been unable to walk or talk and is totally dependent on her devoted husband John. Since then she has been sleeping on a hospital bed in the kitchen, with no washing or toilet facilities. Joan and John do their best, but Nick Knowles believes they deserve better, so he and his small band of builders - bolstered by an army of local tradespeople - set out to extend the Findlays' home, with designer Oliver Heath on hand to protect his vision. Can they give June back her dignity?.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Aled Jones helps a couple from Enfield, north London, find a detached property in Essex on a budget of £400,000. Their wish list is long, including rural views, a big kitchen, and a garden with enough space to create a veggie plot.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse tries to find a couple their first home together in Wiltshire, but they are hoping to locate a party pad with a big kitchen, plenty of bedrooms for friends to stay, and land for a horse.(n)

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Law & Disorder
programme.sub-title: Louis Theroux: Law & Disorder in Lagos.
programme.desc: The journalist meets gangs known as Area Boys as they patrol their neighbourhoods in the Nigerian city of Lagos, clashing with rivals in a bid to keep the peace on the streets. He is taken under the wing of their leader MC, a street youth who is now friends with the most powerful men in the city, and also spends time with the government's paramilitary tasks force, whose ruthless tactics are not that different to those of the gangs.(n)

programme.title: Married Behind Bars
programme.desc: Every bride dreams of the perfect wedding day, but what happens when the groom is in prison? In 2014, in California alone, more than 1,800 weddings took place behind bars, and this documentary follows the stories of three American women who have decided to tie the knot while their partners are serving time. Negotiating a myriad regulations and restrictions, the couples must follow strict dress codes, walk down the aisle via an X-ray machine and kiss each other through bulletproof glass.(n)

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The Humberside Police force's traffic cops have their hands full during the half-term holidays, chasing youths as young as 13 as they attempt to steal, crash and burn cars. Jamie Theakston narrates.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A retired policeman is killed in a diamond robbery, and the vengeful team soon picks up a clue as one of the culprits has left behind a trail of blood. However, rather than make an immediate arrest, McGarrett and Danno stake out the robber's girlfriend, who was also involved in the crime, hoping to pick up both of them at the same time - and as the hours pass, it becomes clear the colleagues have a few issues to resolve. US crime drama, starring Alex O'Loughlin and Scott Caan. Directed by series star Daniel Dae Kim, who plays Chin Ho.(n)

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: Elite officers Rosie and Darren carry out a manhunt through the gardens of an upmarket estate, while Chris and Simon come face to face with a notorious drug addict in Milton Keynes.(n)

programme.title: Police 10/7
programme.desc: Following the work of police officers in New Zealand, featuring behind-the-scenes access to cases and revealing new information about high profile crimes. Hosted and narrated by Detective Sergeant Rob Lemoto.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Grover's oldest friend tells him he saw his wife fall off a cliff to her death - but the officer's suspicious instincts come to the fore and he begins to think it was no accident. Meanwhile, Danny and Dr Shaw get trapped in a lift with a dead body.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and the team investigate the death of a biotech executive who was working on a highly profitable vaccine - and it isn't long before the finger of blame is pointing at a criminal organisation. Deeks returns to the field, but is he ready after such a traumatic experience? Chris O'Donnell and Eric Christian Olsen star.(n)

programme.sub-title: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch.

programme.desc: Phil steps up to the plate to cook Thanksgiving dinner, employing Luke as his sous chef. However, Claire is not convinced the pair can pull it off, so buys a back-up bird. Jay and Gloria's plan to go away for the holiday is scuppered, so the pair decide to maintain a low profile. Meanwhile, Mitch forces Cam to play bad cop when Lily refuses to wear a nice dress. Nigella Lawson guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch reluctantly lets his distressed colleague Brenda stay the night, Phil and Claire think Alex has let her imagination run wild after she tells them she has a boyfriend, and Jay hits a Manny-shaped obstacle while trying to get out of accompanying Gloria to a party. Kirsten Johnston (3rd Rock from the Sun) guest stars, with Jesse Tyler Ferguson, Ty Burrell, Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen.(n)

programme.title: Futurama

programme.title: Futurama

The windfall prompts Fry to buy 100 cups of coffee, Professor Farnsworth to rub stem cells all over himself in a bid to reclaim his youth and Bender to buy burglary tools so he can steal an expensive cigar.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer gets a new job at a better nuclear power plant, forcing the family to move to an apparently idyllic community - but his boss turns out to be a megalomaniac super-villain with dreams of world domination. Featuring the guest voice of Albert Brooks.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer wins $1million on the lottery, but keeps it a secret from his family, fearing Marge's reaction if she finds out about it. He and Bart set about spending the money, and buy front-row tickets to a Coldplay concert. With the guest voice of Chris Martin.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart and Lisa put an end to Homer and Marge's romantic evenings when a traumatic incident forces them to return home early from camp.(n)

Comedy, starring Rhashan Stone, Kerry Godliman, Rio Chambers and James Van Der Beek.(n)
